items.title: Software Engineer: Site Reliability and Infrastructure
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=1, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=6, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Sticker Mule is looking for Site Reliability Engineers to help improve the reliability and performance of our cloud infrastructure. In this role, you'll also build and maintain the tools our engineers use to deploy our services dozens of times a day. Your work will meaningfully impact the experience of our customers and the happiness of our engineering teams.
**Who we are**
Sticker Mule is the Internet's fastest-growing printing company. We are privately-owned, profitable, and powered by an outstanding, globally distributed team who cares deeply about delivering a great customer experience at the highest technical standards. Our software engineering team operates from 20 different countries, and we're always looking for more exceptional engineers to join us.
See more about our teams [here](https://www.stickermule.com/about)
**What you'll do**
1. You'll design, build, and maintain the tools our software engineers use daily to develop, test, and deploy services.
2. You'll work to improve the performance, reliability, and security of the Sticker Mule cloud infrastructure.
3. You'll collaborate with other engineering teams and stakeholders to ensure we're always building the right solution.
4. You'll share your expertise with other members of the team, review your peers' code, and mentor other engineers.
5. You'll participate in periodic on-call duties.
**About you**
1. You have been a professional software engineer for 3+ years.
2. You're highly skilled in two or more general-purpose languages, and one of those languages is Go.
3. You have Linux roots, you contain with Docker, you schedule with Kubernetes.
4. You have automated complex tasks with Bash.
5. You have practical experience with more than one cloud provider, AWS and Google Cloud would be especially beneficial.
6. You used logging, monitoring and distributed tracing systems.
7. You have excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.
**Why you should join**
We believe high performing organizations include people from different backgrounds and experiences. We are committed to building a safe, supportive work environment where team members can bring their diverse perspectives.
In joining the Sticker Mule team, you'll have the opportunity to make a significant impact as part of a small, highly motivated team. We have a large variety of interesting technical problems, and we offer above-market compensation. We strive to provide a sensible balance between work and non-work, and we allow you to define your own schedule.
**How the process works**
You’ll send us your application including samples of your code and writing. Alternatively, if you don’t have any samples or can’t provide them, you can do a take-home test.
Selected candidates will be invited to begin our interview process:
2. An introductory interview
3. A technical discussion with other engineers, where we'll go through your technical background and the samples you provided. We might also ask you a few technical questions.
4. A final meeting with our VP of HR.
**Compensation and benefits**
1. $90,000-$115,000+ depending on experience.
2. Signing bonus.
3. 4 weeks vacation.

items.title: Devops Engineer 50% Remote
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=4, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=2, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=4, apple=0, java=4, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
DevOps Engineer Responsibilities
  • Apply cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP) computing skills to deploy upgrades and fixes.
  • Design, develop, and implement software integrations based on user feedback.
  • Troubleshoot production issues and coordinate with the development team to streamline code deployment.
  • Implement automation tools and frameworks (CI/CD pipelines).
  • Analyze code and communicate detailed reviews to development teams to ensure a marked improvement in applications and the timely completion of projects.
  • Collaborate with team members to improve the company?s engineering tools, systems and procedures, and data security.
  • Optimize the company?s computing architecture.
  • Conduct systems tests for security, performance, and availability.
  • Develop and maintain design and troubleshooting documentation.
DevOps Engineer Requirements
  • You possess a Bachelor?s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or relevant field.
  • You have 3+ years experience as a DevOps Engineer or equivalent software-engineering role.
  • You are an expert in code deployment tools (Puppet, Ansible, and Chef).
  • You can maintain Java web applications.
  • You have experience in network, server, and application-status monitoring.
  • You possess a strong command of software-automation production systems (Jenkins and Selenium).
  • You exhibit expertise in software development methodologies.
  • You have working knowledge of Ruby or Python and known DevOps tools like Git and GitHub.
  • You have a working knowledge of databases and SQL (Structured Query Language).
  • You possess a problem-solving attitude.
  • You can work independently and as part of a team.
DevOps engineering is an emerging science that bridges the software development and user experience aspects of a company?s information-technology systems. Securing an experienced DevOps engineer to steer your team and optimize your company?s internal systems and practices will improve your company?s productivity.

items.content:
We currently have openings for enthusiastic people with a good phone presence and practical computer skills. ? Since we are open 24/7/365 this position may require weekends, some holidays and variable shifts. ? We are interested in people who can help us:
  • Ensure PhoenixET builds, fosters and maintains positive customer relationships throughout the service call process
  • Support the customer and field technicians
  • Process information in response to inquiries, concerns and requests for technical help using company supported computer applications and platforms ?
THIS IS A REMOTE POSITION - WORKED FROM HOME - ANYWHERE IN THE UNITED STATES

ABOUT O UR C OMPANY AND THE P OSITION

Founded in 2004, Phoenix Energy Technologies is a leading provider of Enterprise Energy Management Software and Services. PhoenixET works with commercial, retail, grocery, pharmacy, healthcare and higher education customers to diagnose opportunities and implement strategies which reduce energy consumption and costs. Through real time measurement and verification of energy use, related costs and contextual data (such as weather, occupancy, and schedules) PhoenixET helps its customers obtain a "full view" of energy consumption and costs in order to drive efficiencies, reduce energy spend, and deliver maximum ROI.

?

Bring your technical expertise and excellent customer service skills to our dynamic, collaborative EMS team. PhoenixET is growing (and growing fast) through our groundbreaking energy management software and best-in-class EMS services arm. ?

?

We are currently seeking A-players who are ready to jump into a fun, fast and furious paced environment. We are pretty keen on the environment, so if you have a passion for all things green like we do, even better. As we expand our team of experienced, motivated HVAC/Energy Management Systems Technicians, we seek the right individuals to deliver superior customer service to our growing list of Fortune 1000 customers. ? There is lots of opportunity to learn and grow at PhoenixET. ? We support the upward mobility and education of our employees and promote from within.

Shifts may vary and may include Monday through Friday, overnight, or weekends

R OLE AND R ESPONSIBILITIES

? ???????? Ensure PhoenixET builds/ fosters/maintains positive customer relationships throughout service call process

? ???????? Support the customer and field technicians

? ???????? Process information in response to inquiries/concerns/requests for technical help using company supported applications and platforms

? ???????? Troubleshoot service requests and advise on appropriate action

? ???????? Answer incoming service requests professionally

? ???????? Enter service request information into database from phone calls or emails

? ???????? Research questions using database and team members input

? ???????? Process and resolve customer complaints

? ???????? Review service call requests from clients, review systems online, and adjust or repair to avoid dispatching field ? techs

? ???????? Identify problems, troubleshoot and make decisions to bring issues to conclusion

? ???????? Interact with contractors at remote locations working on mechanical equipment

? ???????? Complete EMS service calls and redirect to higher level techs as needed

? ???????? Prepare reports based on clients specifications

? ???????? Perform schedule changes in Energy Management software

? ???????? Review Energy Management alarms, resolve or redirect to appropriate resource

Q UALIFICATIONS AND E DUCATION R EQUIREMENTS

? ???????? HVAC, Refrigeration and Energy Management Monitoring Experience including various monitoring ? ? ? ? ?s oftware and controls: Novar, CPC, Trane Summit, etc.

? ???????? Technical or mechanical background with an emphasis on Refrigeration, HVAC or Electrical principles

? ???????? Strong computer skills and Microsoft Office proficiency

? ???????? Customer service experience

? ???????? Strong keyboard skills

? ???????? Strong communication and organizational skills

? ???????? Excellent verbal and written communications skills

? ???????? Ability to prioritize and complete a variety of simultaneous tasks

? ???????? Technical and problem solving skills

? ???????? Attention to detail

? ???????? Ability to work under pressure

? ???????? Work well on cross-functional teams

? ???????? Highly motivated with personal initiative

? ???????? Bi-Lingual (Spanish) Language skills a plus

? ???????? Trane and/or refrigeration experience is a plus

P HOENIX ET C ULTURE AND B ENEFITS

? ???????? Our Culture is one of the most important components of our Company.

? ???????? We believe in teamwork, family, integrity, character and support personal and professional growth and development

? ???????? We believe in mentoring our employees and encourage opportunities which support promotion from within

? ???????? We offer competitive benefits including medical, dental, vision and life insurance, 401K, as well as a flexible PTO and Holiday plan

? ???????? We provide educational and personal development opportunities

? ???????? Need not live in California, but must live in the U.S. ? ? this is a remote, work from home position

? ???????? WE HIRE, SUPPORT AND GROW GREAT PEOPLE!

?

Experience:

? ???????? Customer service or call-center experience a plus

? ???????? HVAC, refrigeration, or energy systems experience necessary

MUST BE ABLE TO WORK IN THE UNITED STATES FOR ANY EMPLOYER WITHOUT SPONSORSHIP

items.content:
We are working with a premier consulting partner who is a leader in DevOps Automation who are growing extensively and looking for extremely experienced DevOps Engineers. Their projects and clients range anywhere from finance to health care and more with their entire company working remote - so they know how to get it done.

As a Senior DevOps Automation Engineer, you will come from a development background and have previous consulting experience. Much of your projects with be development and automation focused so a DevOps and agile mentality is key.

Skills & Qualifications
  • At least 5+ years in a DevOps consulting role
  • Proficiency in a high level programming language - Python, Java, or Ruby
  • Terraform or CloudFormation expert
  • Strong AWS knowledge
  • Experience building out CI/CD pipelines
Benefits
  • Unlimited PTO
  • Growth plans laid out - internal promotions are always avalible
  • Laptop provided
  • Medical, dental and vision all provided
  • Retirement plan
If you are interested in this opportunity or any other with Amazon Web Services please e-mail your CV and contact details to Amanda Hunt at [Click Here to Email Your Resum?] or call x3849.
Jefferson Frank is the global leader for Amazon Web Services recruitment, advertising more AWS and DevOps jobs than any other agency. We deal with both AWS Partners & End Users throughout North America. By specializing solely in placing candidates in the AWS and DevOps market I have built relationships with most of the key employers in North America and have an unrivalled understanding of where the best opportunities and AWS / DevOps jobs are.

At Jefferson Frank, our mission is simple: we want happy customers. Whether you're an AWS professional walking into your dream AWS job, or an organization hiring an incredible contractor for your cloud migration project, our goal is to deliver an unrivalled customer experience. AWS Partner looking for a passionate AWS DevOps Engineer to join their team on a remote basis. You will need to be highly motivated, to help take the team to the next level, share experience with team members and be a trusted advisor to clients.
The role
  • Tackle complex hands-on technical challenges including research when dealing with unknowns.
  • Design and develop solutions.
  • Design and build a control repository strategy.
  • Train the DevOps Teams to automate the set-up of the jobs in the CI/CD products.
You need
  • 60-80% travel availability
  • Excellent and precise interpersonal skills.
  • Development Experience
  • Client Facing experience
  • Experience in a DevOps CI/CD environment.
Tools: Jenkins, Maven, Git, Nexus, Perl/Python/Java, Groovy, Grunt, Gulp, Selenium, Chef, Puppet, Ansible and more.

AWS, DevOps

items.title: Sr.DevOps Engineer-DevOps Agency-100% REMOTE/75% Travel - $160K
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=6, other=0, dotnet=10, c=4, mobile=3, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=6, apple=0, java=6, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Sr. DevOps Engineer - DevOps Agency- 100% REMOTE/75% Travel - $160k
Our client, a boutique DevOps Consulting firm is seeking a 100% Remote Sr. DevOps Engineer to join their growing DevOps team. We're looking for candidates from a good programming background (specifically either Python, Ruby, Java or C#) and experience working within an AWS DevOps environment. You will be responsible for implementing automation solutions that help speed increase the speed of my clients customer's ability to deliver features to production
Responsibilities -
  • Integrate, Automate and Migrate on premise applications to AWS.
  • At least 1-2 years of programming experience in either of Python, Java, Ruby or C#
  • Familiarity with complete suite of AWS Services, with particular in those that are heavily used when providing DevOps Automation solutions, including tools like CloudFormation, EC2, Route53, S3, etc.
  • 2-5+ years of technical experience in either development, operations, or full-stack implementations
  • Frequent and comfortable use of configuration management automation tools such as Chef. Puppet or Ansible creating continuous delivery systems
Desired Skills:
  • Strong experience working with AWS environment
  • Expertise in containerization with Docker or Kubernetes
  • Experience building pipeline with CI/CD tools Jenkins
  • AWS Professional Certification
Interviews have already begun so if you are interested in applying or know someone who is please contact Vishank Mehta immediately at [Click Here to Email Your Resum?] with an updated resume, or call

items.title: Azure DevOps Engineer - $65/hr -$80/hr - FULLY REMOTE!
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=4, other=0, dotnet=7, c=7, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=10, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
My client who is headquartered in Jacksonville, Florida is looking to add an Azure DevOps Engineer to their team. This company is a MS Gold Partner that helps their clients develop software applications on Microsoft platforms. They focus on helping clients reduce cost by optimizing their outsourcing partnerships which allow them to ascend into the cloud space at a faster and more reliable rate. As an engineer you will work on scaling infrastructure and well as hold a client facing role. You will be working in an environment that encourages friendly competition that drives company culture. 6-9 month contract. Project is set to start mid January!
  • Hands-on expertise working on CICD pipeline
  • Excellent understanding on distributed applications in an enterprise environment
  • Hands-on experience with cloud environments like Microsoft Azure or GCP.
  • Great communication and client facing skills
  • Manage infrastructure and experience with automation tools
  • Experience in Linux environments and with virtualization technologies
  • Experience with multiple programming languages suchs as C, Jave, Python, ect.
  • Knowledge and experience with Docker/Kubernetes, Ansible, Jenkins, Terraform, HA Proxy/Squid

Nigel Frank International is working in partnership with a mid-size consulting company with rapidly expanding DevOps and Cloud teams! This innovative firm offers a lot of opportunity for growth, and embraces fresh perspectives. They foster an invigorating and inspiring community of highly talented individuals - employees are encouraged to learn from one another, and to share their expertise. This permanent role will be 100% remote and will require travel.
This firm is looking to bring on a DevOps Engineer with a broad technical skillset. They are seeking candidates that have experience working hands-on with Microsoft Azure, and demonstrate breadth of experience / proficiency with DevOps tools, such as: GIT, Jenkins, Bamboo, SonarQ, Teraform, Puppet, Chef, Ansible, Splunk, Agile.

Required Skills / Experience:
  • At least 3-5 years of experience working as an Engineer.
  • Be adaptable and flexible.
  • Ability to be a "jack of all trades".
  • Breadth of experience with DevOps tools.
  • Proven experience configuring release automation tools.
  • Proficiency with multiple containers/container orchestration tools like Kubernetes and Docker.
  • Strong experience with Ruby and Python (and the like).
  • Experience working with multiple configuration management tools.
  • Exceptional knowledge of and experience with Azure.
  • Experience using multiple Infrastructure as Code tools like Ansible, Puppet, Chef, Teraform, Etc.
  • Must be willing to travel.
The role itself will be Frontend heavy to consistent DevOps. It will be a mix of hands-on and coordination work as you focus on getting things done according to an existing plan. You will also be responsible for building cloud infrastructure, migrating systems to the cloud, developing tools to assist in the automation of application deployments the monitoring of production environments.
This role is 100% remote, with up to 75% travel. After the 6 month mark, travel requirements will lighten up, but the travel is a vital part of this position.

In order to be submitted as a candidate for this role, you MUST be either a US Citizen or a Green Card holder. Visa sponsorship is not provided.

Job description

Summary

We are looking for an Operations Engineer! Would you like to join the highly dynamic team responsible for the reliability and performance of a global top-10 website — Wikipedia? You would join the Search Team, where we build the infrastructure for search and discovery of Wikipedia content. We are working on Open Source, JVM / Linux based stacks (Elasticsearch, Wikidata Query Service).

We are searching for people with a drive to explore, experiment, and learn new technologies. Do you enjoy eliminating boring things from your daily workflow by automating them? Are you comfortable working in a highly collaborative, consensus-oriented, open environment and as part of a globally-distributed team? Then you might be just the person we need.

Responsibilities

  • Performing day-to-day operational and DevOps tasks on Wikimedia’s public facing infrastructure (deployment, maintenance, configuration, troubleshooting)
  • Implementing and utilizing configuration management and deployment tools (Puppet, Kubernetes)
  • Assisting in the architectural design of new services and making them operate, at scale
  • Monitoring of systems, services and service clusters, optimization of performance and resource utilization
  • Assisting in or leading incident responses, diagnosis and follow-up on system outages or alerts across Wikimedia’s production infrastructure
  • Sharing our values and working in accordance with them

Qualifications

  • 3+ years experience in an SRE/Operations/DevOps role as part of a team
  • Experience with managing geographically distributed, highly available, high-traffic infrastructure based on JVM / Linux
  • Working understanding of garbage collection, Java logging frameworks and JMX
  • Comfortable with Open Source configuration management and orchestration tools (Puppet, Ansible, Chef, SaltStack, etc.)
  • Experience with the use, and configuration of, monitoring, metrics and logging infrastructure (Icinga/Nagios, Prometheus, Grafana, Graphite, Logstash/Kibana, etc.)
  • Comfortable with shell and scripting languages used in an SRE/Operations engineering context (Python, Go, Bash, Ruby, etc.)
  • Comfortable with managing remotely bare-metal servers and virtualized environments
  • Aptitude for automation and streamlining of tasks
  • Strong English-language skills and ability to work independently, as an effective part of a globally distributed team
  • B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science or equivalent work experience

Pluses

  • Track record of open source contributions is a major plus
  • Experience with Elasticsearch
  • Experience with graph databases
  • Low level systems troubleshooting and debugging (CPU/memory profiling, C/C++ experience, in-depth Linux knowledge)

Example projects

These are some of our upcoming projects you might be working on soon…

  • Upgrade a multi-terabyte Elasticsearch cluster to the next version of software, without any impact to our users (or uptime)
  • Scale our graph database (Wikidata Query Service) to more than 10 billion triples
  • Help define a hardware procurement strategy to grow our Elasticsearch cluster

The Wikimedia Foundation is... 

...the nonprofit organization that hosts and operates Wikipedia and the other Wikimedia free knowledge projects. Our vision is a world in which every single human can freely share in the sum of all knowledge. We believe that everyone has the potential to contribute something to our shared knowledge, and that everyone should be able to access that knowledge, free of interference. We host the Wikimedia projects, build software experiences for reading, contributing, and sharing Wikimedia content, support the volunteer communities and partners who make Wikimedia possible, and advocate for policies that enable Wikimedia and free knowledge to thrive. The Wikimedia Foundation is a charitable, not-for-profit organization that relies on donations. We receive financial support from millions of individuals around the world, with an average donation of about $15. We also receive donations through institutional grants and gifts. The Wikimedia Foundation is a United States 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization with offices in San Francisco, California, USA.

The Wikimedia Foundation is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply

U.S. Benefits & Perks*

  • Fully paid medical, dental and vision coverage for employees and their eligible families (yes, fully paid premiums!)
  • The Wellness Program provides reimbursement for mind, body and soul activities such as fitness memberships, baby sitting, continuing education and much more
  • The 401(k) retirement plan offers matched contributions at 4% of annual salary
  • Flexible and generous time off - vacation, sick and volunteer days, plus 19 paid holidays - including the last week of the year.
  • Family friendly! 100% paid new parent leave for seven weeks plus an additional five weeks for pregnancy, flexible options to phase back in after leave, fully equipped lactation room.
  • For those emergency moments - long and short term disability, life insurance (2x salary) and an employee assistance program
  • Pre-tax savings plans for health care, child care, elder care, public transportation and parking expenses
  • Telecommuting and flexible work schedules available
  • Appropriate fuel for thinking and coding (aka, a pantry full of treats) and monthly massages to help staff relax
  • Great colleagues - diverse staff and contractors speaking dozens of languages from around the world, fantastic intellectual discourse, mission-driven and intensely passionate people

*Eligible international workers' benefits are specific to their location and dependent on their employer of record

More information

Wikimedia Foundation website

Wikimedia Foundation blog

Annual Report - 2017

Wikimedia 2030

Apply now

About Wikimedia Foundation, Inc.

The Wikimedia Foundation is...

...the nonprofit organization that supports Wikipedia and the other Wikimedia free knowledge projects. Our vision is a world in which every single human can freely share in the sum of all knowledge. We believe that everyone has the potential to contribute something to our shared knowledge, and that everyone should be able to access that knowledge, free of interference. We host the Wikimedia projects, build software experiences for reading, contributing, and sharing Wikimedia content, support the volunteer communities and partners who make Wikimedia possible, and advocate for policies that enable Wikimedia and free knowledge to thrive. The Wikimedia Foundation is a charitable, not-for-profit organization that relies on donations. We receive financial support from millions of individuals around the world, with an average donation of about $15. We also receive donations through institutional grants and gifts. The Wikimedia Foundation is a United States 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization with offices in San Francisco, California, USA.

The Wikimedia Foundation is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply.

bevacqua Senior Software Engineer at Elastic, and JavaScript Consultant, Speaker, Published Author 28k 41 143 270
tsg 1.8k 9 10
cstrzadala 146 5
drewr 1.4k 14 20

Job description

At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects — Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats — we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. Diversity drives our vibe. We unite Elasticians employees across 30+ countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.

About The Role:

You will be responsible for technical design and work in the User Journey area of Elastic’s Cloud product. The User Journey area is a cross-functional team responsible for trial user flow, UX, design and development of Elastic’s Cloud user portal, integrations with 3rd party hosting providers, and more. You will lead by example and should participate in coding, debugging complex failure scenarios, and triaging bugs. You’ll analyze the current system, it’s strength and limitations. You will participate in roadmap and project planning efforts and will have ownership for delivering it. You’ll be participating in project management efforts as the teams execute on plans, and you’ll have a role in communicating progress and status to stakeholders.

Engineering Philosophy:

Engineering a highly complex distributed system that is easy to operate via elegantly designed components and APIs is a non-trivial effort. It requires solid software development skills, and more meaningfully, a sharp mind and the ability to think like a user. We care deeply about giving you full ownership of what you’re working on. Our company fundamentally believes phenomenal minds achieve greatness when they are set free and are surrounded and challenged by their peers, which is clearly visible in our organization. We feel that anyone needs to be in a position to comment on truly anything, regardless of his or her role within the company. Does this sound like you? Then you should click apply!

Some of the things you'll work on:

  • Work with a distributed team of engineers from all across the globe.
  • Lead our efforts to measure, monitor, and improve our platform performance. This includes things like: How do we measure changes in performance behavior each time we release? What are our key areas that contribute to production issues? How do we identify and address them?
  • Craft end-to-end modules making it easy for users to connect and visualize data within minutes. You will collaborate with the Elasticsearch and the Kibana teams to build dashboards, define data schema, new transformation and processors, etc.
  • Own, curate, and execute the Cloud User Journey area product roadmap, collaborating with product managers, engineering managers, and other stakeholders across Cloud and Elastic teams.
  • Understand our company strategy and help to translate it into technical deliverables and guide Cloud’s product direction to realize it.
  • Create technical designs and build POCs for new efforts, validating a wild idea works before contributing to it.
  • Be a contact point in Cloud for other teams within Elastic. Examples include helping Support with difficult cases or consulting the Elastic Stack engineers with designing new features in a Cloud compatible way.
  • Be hands-on with the codebase. Review work done by the team, and provide constructive feedback.
  • Help the team define coding practices and standards.

What you will bring along:

  • A track record of successfully leading multi-functional teams to deliver quality content.
  • Previous experience working with stakeholders outside of Engineering.
  • You have 5-7 years experience in a hands-on Javascript programming role.
  • Comfortable working and communicating with teams from several functions – design, data analytics, and distributed engineering.
  • You have worked on a SAAS platform or product.
  • Previous experience in an ownership role for roadmap curation and execution.
  • Experience integrating with marketplace and/or console offers from hosting providers (Azure, GCP, etc.) is a huge plus.
  • A self starter who with experience working across multiple technical teams and decision makers

Additional Information:

  • Deeply competitive pay and benefits
  • Equity compensation
  • Catered lunches, snacks, and beverages in most offices
  • An environment in which you can balance great work with a great life
  • Passionate people building phenomenal products

Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

Apply now

About Elastic

Elastic builds software to make data usable in real time and at scale for search, logging, security, and analytics use cases. Founded in 2012, the company develops the open source Elastic Stack (Elasticsearch, Kibana, Beats, and Logstash), X-Pack (commercial features), and Elastic Cloud (a SaaS offering). To date, there have been more than 100 million cumulative downloads. The Elastic community is 100,000 members strong. Thousands of organizations including Cisco, eBay, Goldman Sachs, NASA, Microsoft, Mayo Clinic, The New York Times, Wikipedia, and Verizon use Elastic to power mission-critical systems. Backed by Benchmark Capital, Index Ventures, and NEA with more than $100 million in funding, Elastic has a distributed workforce with more than 600 employees in 30 countries. Learn more at elastic.co

Benefits

  • 401k Matching Up to 6 % in US and Pensions in some other countries
  • Vacation to be determined by location
  • 100% distributed work
  • Spacetime (Program for any developer in any team to innovate)
  • Donation matching
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Engineering All-Hands bi-annually
  • Volunteer Time-Off

  • Linux
  • Terraform

    • Intro

    About us

    Keep the world moving with intelligent code. Join our global developers community and help us create the NEXT BIG THING. Have an impact.

    Here at Daimler Trucks and Buses Tech & Data HUB we are looking for creative, savvy and hungry minds. BECOME PART OF THE HUB.

    Boost your career within our international expert community and enter the digital world of Trucks & Buses. Help us create a more sustainable, eco-friendly and smart world. You will be able to explore different business units and continuously develop your tech skills in high-impact projects.

    #AutonomousDriving #EMobility #Connectivity #MachineLearning #ArtificialIntelligence #BigData #DataScience #SoftwareDevelopment

    We're looking for experienced DevOps Engineers to join our team in Lisbon to work on an exciting projects and products for the world’s biggest Trucks and Buses manufacturer.  We are part of DAIMLER.

    About you
    You have an entrepreneurial mindset and love building new things from scratch. You are willing to constantly challenge yourself by learning new approaches and technologies and encourage a culture of mutual learning and collaboration.

    Responsibilities:

    • Build infrastructure as code for all the necessary architecture components
    • Analyze and define best practices for security and network of the infrastructure
    • Maintain all jobs with improvements and bug fixes as needed
    • Support on the maintenance of all tooling needed for the CI/CD pipelines

    Main requirements

    • You are a visionary, you have a strong desire to not only execute but to contribute, encourage feedback loops and rapid changes, you value communication and interaction over processes and tools, you thrive in an environment of uncertainty and eager to create new business and services
    • You have proven experience with tools such as Terraform and Ansible
    • You have strong Linux know-how
    • You have proven server operation and IT security knowledge
    • You have proven knowledge of setting up networking infrastructure in the Cloud
    • Knowledge on setting up monitoring tools such as Splunk, Datadog, Prometheus, Grafana or ELK

    Nice to have

    • Knowledge in scripting languages such as Python, Go, Ruby
    • Some knowledge of serverless computing and kubernetes
    • You were involved in setting up large scale batch processing jobs (e.g. Hadoop based clusters such as Apache Spark)
    • You were involved in setting up stream processing jobs (Apache Kafka, Apache Storm or similar)

    Perks

    • We have an open-door work culture where ideas and initiatives are encouraged
    • Health insurance for you and your family;
    • Competitive Salary,
    • The basics: meal card and free drinks/snacks;
    • Nice sunny office in the city center (Lisbon);
    • Flexibility: Morning or evening person? You will decide when to work. We offer super flextime without core working hours.
    • Possibility to work from home;
    • Regular team events;
    • Always wanted to drive a Mercedes? We offer an attractive employee rental program;
    • And since we are a startup we always keep improving!

items.title: Comp. Systems Valid. Proj. Mgr
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(europ, european, europeanunion)
items.content:
Comp. Systems Valid. Proj. Mgr at Charles River Laboratories

Remote | International

Location: Den Bosch, NB, NL

For nearly 70 years, Charles River employees have worked together to assist in the discovery, development and safe manufacture of new drug therapies. When you join our family, you will have a significant impact on the health and well-being of people across the globe. Whether your background is in life sciences, finance, IT, sales or another area, your skills will play an important role in the work e perform. In return, we’ll help you build a career that you can feel passionate about.

We are seeking an experienced Deployment Project Manager for our Safety Assessment site located in Europe.

The candidate can work from anywhere in the world.

Responsibilities:

  • Coordinate internal resources and third parties/vendors for the execution of projects.
  • Coordinate validation effort and ensure completeness of projects and consistency between projects.
  • Define and monitor multiple project deliverables and timelines
  • Define deployment strategies in line with business needs and coordinates activities for multi-sites deployment with business leads.
  • Maintain and provide project timelines and statuses in project management tool.
  • Assist the users and project team in the development if the MVP deliverables.
  • Ensure adherence to pertinent regulatory requirements and to departmental policies, practices and procedures [SOPs, safety procedures and biosafety protocols].
  • Performs analyses and validate benefits related to selected projects.
  • Perform all other related duties as assigned.

We are seeking a candidate who:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
  • Minimum 2 years’ experience in validation and project management
  • Has knowledge in Validation and in GXP, an assets.
  • Demonstrate leadership and resourcefulness.

About Safety Assessment
Charles River is committed to helping our partners expedite their preclinical drug development with exceptional safety assessment services, state-of-the-art facilities and expert regulatory guidance. From individual specialty toxicology and IND enabling studies to tailored packages and total laboratory support, our deeply experienced team can design and execute programs that anticipate challenges and avoid roadblocks for a smooth, efficient journey to market. Each year approximately 120 investigational new drug (IND) programs are conducted in our Safety Assessment facilities.

About Charles River
Charles River is an early-stage contract research organization (CRO). We have built upon our foundation of laboratory animal medicine and science to develop a diverse portfolio of discovery and safety assessment services, both Good Laboratory Practice (GLP) and non-GLP, to support clients from target identification through preclinical development. Charles River also provides a suite of products and services to support our clients’ clinical laboratory testing needs and manufacturing activities. Utilizing this broad portfolio of products and services enables our clients to create a more flexible drug development model, which reduces their costs, enhances their productivity and effectiveness to increase speed to market.

With over 11,000 employees within 70 facilities in 18 countries around the globe, we are strategically positioned to coordinate worldwide resources and apply multidisciplinary perspectives in resolving our client’s unique challenges. Our client base includes global pharmaceutical companies, biotechnology companies, government agencies and hospitals and academic institutions around the world. And in 2016, revenue increased by 23.3% to $1.68 billion from $1.36 billion in 2015.

At Charles River, we are passionate about our role in improving the quality of people’s lives. Our mission, our excellent science and our strong sense of purpose guide us in all that we do, and we approach each day with the knowledge that our work helps to improve the health and well-being of many across the globe. We have proudly supported the development of ~70% of the drugs approved by the FDA in 2016.

For more information, please visit www.criver.com.

Charles River Laboratories, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Disabled/Vet

Apply for job

Tech Stack: DevOps Engineer, Elastic Beanstalk, EC2, Elastic Search, RDS, Lambda, Cloudfront, Bash, Python, Docker, General Linux fault finding, CI/CD pipelines, Jenkins, PHP Web app deployment philosophies and tools, Security best practices in code and infrastructure.

My client is renowned consultancy who is looking to build a world class product using only best practices from ground up. They are looking for a lead DevOps Engineer who has a genuine passion for creating revolutionary solutions. This is a great opportunity for a Lead DevOps engineer who would like to work on cutting edge solutions in a business that is expanding at a phenomenal rate.

As the company expands, you will be a dedicated member of the DevOps team where your ideas will be taken on board and essentially shape the company into a market leader within their field.

Culture: This is an environment where they like to embrace new technologies and they provide a platform for you to grow alongside the growth of the business. They have exceptionally high staff retention off the back of a friendly, supportive, mutual-trusting atmosphere.

Expertise/Responsibilities:

  • Previous experience as: Senior DevOps Engineer, Head of DevOps, DevOps Manager, DevOps Lead, DevOps Specialist, DevOps Consultant.
  • Architect new solutions and processes
  • Design and implement CI/CD pipelines
  • Lead Dev Ops Engineer will be part of an ambitious transformation programme that will transform the company, leveraging cloud services and functionality for IT services.
  • Lead the DevOps function and be principally involved in the creation of exciting Greenfield capabilities and products.

Salary: up to £85,000, 28 days of holiday, healthcare plus many more

items.content:
Avanti Recruitment are delighted to be working alongside a leading Cyber Risk Security company that specialises in protecting businesses from external online risks across the web.

Our client is looking for a DevOps Engineer to work closely with the software development team to support in the delivery of their product to their customers. You will be able to demonstrate your knowledge of Infrastructure as Code (IAC) and explain the benefits.

Their platform is hosted on AWS so you will have strong working experience with Amazon Web Services as well as Docker and Terraform and experience within an Agile environment is strongly preferred. NoSQL or clustered database support and scripting with Bash or Python would be advantageous.

They are ideally looking for DevOps engineers with experience of working with Java systems but you do not need to be a developer. Any experience with applications that handle large volumes of data would be considered a plus.

They are looking for good communicators with a friendly approach, willing to support others in delivering efficiently and on time for the end user.

The DevOps team have a real passion for technology and automation and they are looking to bring in like-minded people. They want someone that can contribute to the overall direction and development of DevOps within the business going forward, looking at continuous improvement of processes, technologies and automation.

Our client offers remote working for up to 3 days per week which will certainly help when it comes to work/life balance! Other benefits include a 4% matched pension, private medical cover, income protection, life assurance, travel insurance and much more.

If this opportunity is of interest to you, please apply now for immediate consideration.

items.content:
Senior DevOps Engineer

We're Linel, a DevOps-owned and run, 100% remote shop.

We have an immediate requirement for a strong senior DevOps engineer.

# Duration
Short-term contract. Starting very soon and going to early November.

# Project
Migrate a complex system from Joyent to another cloud provider.

## Technologies
haproxy
redis
twemproxy
solr
rails 4.0.13
ruby 2.1.5
unicorn
nginx
sidekiq
rabbitmq
lapine
S3
postgres
pgbouncer
prometheus
circonous
new relic
nagios
statsd
logging needs to change
redshift
fastly cdn
capistrano
docker
syslog

## Candidate
This isn't a good project for a beginner or intermediate engineer. The complexity, old age, nuance i.e. brittleness, and time frame require a senior engineer.

If you're another dev shop please do not inquire about this opening. We treat all such emails as spam. Sorry, but otherwise we get flooded with emails that make it harder to find the candidates we're actually advertising to find. Thank you.

APPLY FOR THIS POSITION

Please send a link to your resume, Web site, and Github account, whichever is applicable, to: jobs@linelinc.com Please use the subject line: “[WWR] DevOps.” Please also include links to any projects or code that demonstrates your capabilities. Given the volume of replies we usually get, this will help us differentiate you from other candidates. If you don't hear back from us, please accept our apologies in advance. We're a small shop and we don't have dedicated HR staff or a recruiter, so we reply only to the most promising candidates.

DevOps Engineer Responsibilities
  • Apply cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP) computing skills to deploy upgrades and fixes.
  • Design, develop, and implement software integrations based on user feedback.
  • Troubleshoot production issues and coordinate with the development team to streamline code deployment.
  • Implement automation tools and frameworks (CI/CD pipelines).
  • Analyze code and communicate detailed reviews to development teams to ensure a marked improvement in applications and the timely completion of projects.
  • Collaborate with team members to improve the company?s engineering tools, systems and procedures, and data security.
  • Optimize the company?s computing architecture.
  • Conduct systems tests for security, performance, and availability.
  • Develop and maintain design and troubleshooting documentation.
DevOps Engineer Requirements
  • You possess a Bachelor?s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or relevant field.
  • You have 3+ years experience as a DevOps Engineer or equivalent software-engineering role.
  • You are an expert in code deployment tools (Puppet, Ansible, and Chef).
  • You can maintain Java web applications.
  • You have experience in network, server, and application-status monitoring.
  • You possess a strong command of software-automation production systems (Jenkins and Selenium).
  • You exhibit expertise in software development methodologies.
  • You have working knowledge of Ruby or Python and known DevOps tools like Git and GitHub.
  • You have a working knowledge of databases and SQL (Structured Query Language).
  • You possess a problem-solving attitude.
  • You can work independently and as part of a team.
DevOps engineering is an emerging science that bridges the software development and user experience aspects of a company?s information-technology systems. Securing an experienced DevOps engineer to steer your team and optimize your company?s internal systems and practices will improve your company?s productivity.

  • Process information in response to inquiries, concerns and requests for technical help using company supported computer applications and platforms ?
THIS IS A REMOTE POSITION - WORKED FROM HOME - ANYWHERE IN THE UNITED STATES

ABOUT O UR C OMPANY AND THE P OSITION

Founded in 2004, Phoenix Energy Technologies is a leading provider of Enterprise Energy Management Software and Services. PhoenixET works with commercial, retail, grocery, pharmacy, healthcare and higher education customers to diagnose opportunities and implement strategies which reduce energy consumption and costs. Through real time measurement and verification of energy use, related costs and contextual data (such as weather, occupancy, and schedules) PhoenixET helps its customers obtain a "full view" of energy consumption and costs in order to drive efficiencies, reduce energy spend, and deliver maximum ROI.

?

Bring your technical expertise and excellent customer service skills to our dynamic, collaborative EMS team. PhoenixET is growing (and growing fast) through our groundbreaking energy management software and best-in-class EMS services arm. ?

?

We are currently seeking A-players who are ready to jump into a fun, fast and furious paced environment. We are pretty keen on the environment, so if you have a passion for all things green like we do, even better. As we expand our team of experienced, motivated HVAC/Energy Management Systems Technicians, we seek the right individuals to deliver superior customer service to our growing list of Fortune 1000 customers. ? There is lots of opportunity to learn and grow at PhoenixET. ? We support the upward mobility and education of our employees and promote from within.

Shifts may vary and may include Monday through Friday, overnight, or weekends

R OLE AND R ESPONSIBILITIES

? ???????? Ensure PhoenixET builds/ fosters/maintains positive customer relationships throughout service call process

? ???????? Support the customer and field technicians

? ???????? Process information in response to inquiries/concerns/requests for technical help using company supported applications and platforms

? ???????? Troubleshoot service requests and advise on appropriate action

? ???????? Answer incoming service requests professionally

? ???????? Enter service request information into database from phone calls or emails

? ???????? Research questions using database and team members input

? ???????? Process and resolve customer complaints

? ???????? Review service call requests from clients, review systems online, and adjust or repair to avoid dispatching field ? techs

? ???????? Identify problems, troubleshoot and make decisions to bring issues to conclusion

? ???????? Interact with contractors at remote locations working on mechanical equipment

? ???????? Complete EMS service calls and redirect to higher level techs as needed

? ???????? Prepare reports based on clients specifications

? ???????? Perform schedule changes in Energy Management software

? ???????? Review Energy Management alarms, resolve or redirect to appropriate resource

Q UALIFICATIONS AND E DUCATION R EQUIREMENTS

? ???????? HVAC, Refrigeration and Energy Management Monitoring Experience including various monitoring ? ? ? ? ?s oftware and controls: Novar, CPC, Trane Summit, etc.

? ???????? Technical or mechanical background with an emphasis on Refrigeration, HVAC or Electrical principles

? ???????? Strong computer skills and Microsoft Office proficiency

? ???????? Customer service experience

? ???????? Strong keyboard skills

? ???????? Strong communication and organizational skills

? ???????? Excellent verbal and written communications skills

? ???????? Ability to prioritize and complete a variety of simultaneous tasks

? ???????? Technical and problem solving skills

? ???????? Attention to detail

? ???????? Ability to work under pressure

? ???????? Work well on cross-functional teams

? ???????? Highly motivated with personal initiative

? ???????? Bi-Lingual (Spanish) Language skills a plus

? ???????? Trane and/or refrigeration experience is a plus

P HOENIX ET C ULTURE AND B ENEFITS

? ???????? Our Culture is one of the most important components of our Company.

? ???????? We believe in teamwork, family, integrity, character and support personal and professional growth and development

? ???????? We believe in mentoring our employees and encourage opportunities which support promotion from within

? ???????? We offer competitive benefits including medical, dental, vision and life insurance, 401K, as well as a flexible PTO and Holiday plan

? ???????? We provide educational and personal development opportunities

? ???????? Need not live in California, but must live in the U.S. ? ? this is a remote, work from home position

? ???????? WE HIRE, SUPPORT AND GROW GREAT PEOPLE!

?

Experience:

? ???????? Customer service or call-center experience a plus

? ???????? HVAC, refrigeration, or energy systems experience necessary

MUST BE ABLE TO WORK IN THE UNITED STATES FOR ANY EMPLOYER WITHOUT SPONSORSHIP

By specializing solely in placing candidates in the AWS and DevOps market I have built relationships with most of the key employers in North America and have an unrivalled understanding of where the best opportunities and AWS / DevOps jobs are.

items.content:
We currently have openings for enthusiastic people with a good phone presence and practical computer skills. ? Since we are open 24/7/365 this position may require weekends, some holidays and variable shifts. ? We are interested in people who can help us:
  • Ensure PhoenixET builds, fosters and maintains positive customer relationships throughout the service call process
  • Support the customer and field technicians
  • Process information in response to inquiries, concerns and requests for technical help using company supported computer applications and platforms ?
THIS IS A REMOTE POSITION - WORKED FROM HOME - ANYWHERE IN THE UNITED STATES

ABOUT O UR C OMPANY AND THE P OSITION

Founded in 2004, Phoenix Energy Technologies is a leading provider of Enterprise Energy Management Software and Services. PhoenixET works with commercial, retail, grocery, pharmacy, healthcare and higher education customers to diagnose opportunities and implement strategies which reduce energy consumption and costs. Through real time measurement and verification of energy use, related costs and contextual data (such as weather, occupancy, and schedules) PhoenixET helps its customers obtain a "full view" of energy consumption and costs in order to drive efficiencies, reduce energy spend, and deliver maximum ROI.

?

Bring your technical expertise and excellent customer service skills to our dynamic, collaborative EMS team. PhoenixET is growing (and growing fast) through our groundbreaking energy management software and best-in-class EMS services arm. ?

?

We are currently seeking A-players who are ready to jump into a fun, fast and furious paced environment. We are pretty keen on the environment, so if you have a passion for all things green like we do, even better. As we expand our team of experienced, motivated HVAC/Energy Management Systems Technicians, we seek the right individuals to deliver superior customer service to our growing list of Fortune 1000 customers. ? There is lots of opportunity to learn and grow at PhoenixET. ? We support the upward mobility and education of our employees and promote from within.

Shifts may vary and may include Monday through Friday, overnight, or weekends

R OLE AND R ESPONSIBILITIES

? ???????? Ensure PhoenixET builds/ fosters/maintains positive customer relationships throughout service call process

? ???????? Support the customer and field technicians

? ???????? Process information in response to inquiries/concerns/requests for technical help using company supported applications and platforms

? ???????? Troubleshoot service requests and advise on appropriate action

? ???????? Answer incoming service requests professionally

? ???????? Enter service request information into database from phone calls or emails

? ???????? Research questions using database and team members input

? ???????? Process and resolve customer complaints

? ???????? Review service call requests from clients, review systems online, and adjust or repair to avoid dispatching field ? techs

? ???????? Identify problems, troubleshoot and make decisions to bring issues to conclusion

? ???????? Interact with contractors at remote locations working on mechanical equipment

? ???????? Complete EMS service calls and redirect to higher level techs as needed

? ???????? Prepare reports based on clients specifications

? ???????? Perform schedule changes in Energy Management software

? ???????? Review Energy Management alarms, resolve or redirect to appropriate resource

Q UALIFICATIONS AND E DUCATION R EQUIREMENTS

? ???????? HVAC, Refrigeration and Energy Management Monitoring Experience including various monitoring ? ? ? ? ?s oftware and controls: Novar, CPC, Trane Summit, etc.

? ???????? Technical or mechanical background with an emphasis on Refrigeration, HVAC or Electrical principles

? ???????? Strong computer skills and Microsoft Office proficiency

? ???????? Customer service experience

? ???????? Strong keyboard skills

? ???????? Strong communication and organizational skills

? ???????? Excellent verbal and written communications skills

? ???????? Ability to prioritize and complete a variety of simultaneous tasks

? ???????? Technical and problem solving skills

? ???????? Attention to detail

? ???????? Ability to work under pressure

? ???????? Work well on cross-functional teams

? ???????? Highly motivated with personal initiative

? ???????? Bi-Lingual (Spanish) Language skills a plus

? ???????? Trane and/or refrigeration experience is a plus

P HOENIX ET C ULTURE AND B ENEFITS

? ???????? Our Culture is one of the most important components of our Company.

? ???????? We believe in teamwork, family, integrity, character and support personal and professional growth and development

? ???????? We believe in mentoring our employees and encourage opportunities which support promotion from within

? ???????? We offer competitive benefits including medical, dental, vision and life insurance, 401K, as well as a flexible PTO and Holiday plan

? ???????? We provide educational and personal development opportunities

? ???????? Need not live in California, but must live in the U.S. ? ? this is a remote, work from home position

? ???????? WE HIRE, SUPPORT AND GROW GREAT PEOPLE!

?

Experience:

? ???????? Customer service or call-center experience a plus

? ???????? HVAC, refrigeration, or energy systems experience necessary

MUST BE ABLE TO WORK IN THE UNITED STATES FOR ANY EMPLOYER WITHOUT SPONSORSHIP

items.title: AWS DevOps- Automation Engineer- Remote $120,000- $130,000
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=13, c=2, mobile=1, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=2, apple=0, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
AWS DevOps- Automation Engineer- Remote $120,000- $130,000

Ready to expand your knowledge and contribute to new ideas pertaining to engineering autonomy? If you have experience in software development and systems operations with AWS DevOps, this could be the job for you. Our qualified employees work to help enterprises develop fundamentally secure services for faster and more consistent software and infrastructure deployments. We are exclusive to AWS and are excited to increase product functionality.
ROLES & RESPONISBILITIES
We work to provide our customers with the flexibility to be in charge of their own software. By employing industry leading continuous delivery patterns and collaboratively working with other members to execute them, we help our clients to achieve successful solutions. We also collaboratively work with Senior DevOps Automation Engineers to assist and empower customers to come up with self-service solutions and create better outcomes

BENEFITS
  • Work from home
  • Unlimited PTO
  • Flexible schedule
  • Continuous learning opportunities
  • Part of a large distributed remote team
We understand the importance of a work-life balance, which is why we allow our employees to work anywhere with available internet connection. Outside of any core working hours, you could be working from home, the beach, outer space or a coworking space. We value your career goals, as well as our customer's goals, and are happy to allow employees an unlimited amount of PTO. Employees are part of a large distributed remote team. In order to insure you'll never feel alone, we provide employees the tools to stay in touch and collaborate with colleagues, whether that's through simple meetings or a pair programming exercise.

REQUIREMENTS
  • Technical experience in either development, operations, or full-stack
implementations
  • Experience demonstrating programming capability in a high-level programming language such as Ruby, Python, Java, C# or other language
  • Implements successful customer engagements providing continuous delivery solutions, preferably employing AWS
  • Demonstrates Linux or Windows command-line capability
  • Familiar with core suite of AWS Services related to DevOps, with particular depth in those that are heavily used when providing DevOps Automation solutions, including the Management and Deployment services such as AWS CloudFormation, OpsWorks and IAM
  • Experience establishing and employing Continuous Integration practices and tools such as Jenkins or other CI tools
  • Frequent and comfortable use of configuration management automation tools such as Chef (or other such tools) in creating continuous delivery systems
  • AWS Certified Associate (Solutions Architect, Sys Ops, Developer). If you do not already have one or more AWS certifications, we focus on achieving that during a new engineers first 100 days on the job.
For all inquiries about this position, please contact Kayla Lozano at or [Click Here to Email Your Resum?]

Jefferson Frank is a leader in Niche IT Recruitment with a focus on AWS cloud technologies. We deal with AWS partners & End Users throughout North America. We have open positions and relationships with some of the top partners and end users throughout the US and offer some excellent opportunities in the AWS space.

I understand the need for discretion and would welcome the opportunity to speak to any AWS candidates considering a new career or job either now, or in the future. Confidentiality is of the utmost importance. For more information on available AWS jobs, as well as the AWS market, I can be contacted at [Click Here to Email Your Resum?] . Please see for more information.

items.title: Avecto System Administrator II (Remote)
items.content:
Black Knight is the premier provider of integrated technology, services, data and analytics that lenders and servicers look to first to help successfully manage the entire loan life cycle. Our deep understanding of regulatory and compliance issues complements the knowledge, technology and solutions we offer to help our clients achieve their business goals. Black Knight offers leading software systems; data and analytics offerings; and information solutions that facilitate and automate many of the business processes across the mortgage life cycle.

JOB FAMILY DESCRIPTION
Responsible for Black Knights endpoint privilege management software, Defendpoint, as well as other systems, as including the design, installation, configuration, maintenance and system integration testing. Utilizes Avecto Privilege Access Management software in conjunction with Microsoft Group Policy and Web Servers to allow for end users to conduct business through their corporate endpoints without the need for administration rights.

This position is remote / telecommute eligible. If located in Jacksonville, FL some onsite will be required.

GENERAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Installs, maintains and upgrades internal systems used for managing and configuring internal applications.
  • Controls user access and passwords.
  • Secure, controls, manages and monitors privileged access to critical assets.
  • Administers Microsoft Group Policy.
  • Performs endpoint management as well as mentors helpdesk on implemented solutions.
  • Proposes and implements systems enhancements that will improve the reliability and performance of the system.
  • Monitors usage and performance.
  • Trains personnel on system endpoint management usage.
  • Troubleshoots server, software and hardware issues for Endpoint Solutions.
  • Assists with recommending, scheduling and implementing system hardware and/or software upgrades or repairs.
  • Researches, evaluates and recommends software and hardware products.
  • Provides new hardware specifications to users based on application needs and anticipated growth.
  • Performs other duties as required.
EDUCATIONAL GUIDELINES
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or the equivalent combination of education, training, or work experience.

GENERAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES
  • Experience with Endpoint Management Solutions such as Avecto's DefendPoint or other Privilege Access Management systems highly desired
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Group Policy Administration
  • Skilled in troubleshooting
  • Experience with MS Excel for reporting a plus
  • Knowledge of multiple operating systems and related utilities and hardware (servers)
  • Knowledge of TCP/IP
  • Knowledge of network monitoring and tools
  • Knowledge of technical writing principles and practices
  • Experience with Cannon Print Solutions, BigFix, Checkpoint Encryption, vulnerability programs, print and/ or file servers a plus
  • Skill to effectively analyze and solve problems
  • Ability to work independently as well as with a team
  • Ability to communicate effectively verbally and in writing
  • Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with employees, vendors, clients and public
Systems Administrator II
Intermediate professional role requiring moderate skills with high level of proficiency. Solves problems that require analysis and research. Works on small to large, complex projects that require increased skill in multiple technical environments. Extensive knowledge of multiple operating systems and related utilities and hardware. Works on one or more projects as a team member or occasionally as a project lead. May coach more junior technical staff. Works under general supervision with latitude for independent judgment. May consult with senior peers on certain projects. Typically requires four (4) or more years of demonstrated experience.

Black Knight is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, and protected veteran or military family status. Our employees' diversity is our strength, and when we embrace our differences, it makes us better and brighter. Black Knight's commitment to inclusion is at the core of who we are, and motivates us in how we do business each and every day.

Typically requires four (4) or more years of demonstrated experience. (including some experience in Avecto)

items.title: Peerfit: Tech Operations Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}

items.content:
Tech Operations Engineer

Position Summary

Do you love helping other people solve technology problems?  Are you a great communicator with an abundance of empathy for end users?  As a Technology Operations Engineer at Peerfit, you will leverage your expertise and assist the team with navigating the programs and tools we use on a daily basis. You will be responsible for walking employees of all levels through the process of achieving their goal with our team’s software suite, whether the problem relates to a user error, a bug or something else entirely. The Tech Operations Engineer will also be responsible for communicating with customer support, sales and product staff about suspected software problems and support the business as it grows. This may include:

  • Designing and improving support processes for our help desk
  • Handling escalated support inquiries from our help desk
  • Helping automate and scale our business operations
  • Onboarding and offboarding employees to include access provisioning
  • Managing and administering security and compliance platforms
  
Responsibilities
As a Tech Operations Engineer, you’ll be monitoring, maintaining, and supporting the cloud systems, infrastructure, and backoffice software that drive the organization. You will be responsible for designing and implementing support procedures for our help desk, and handling escalations from the help desk when needed. Our team is also responsible for implementing and administering a suite of security and compliance tools for Peerfit.  Occasional business travel, including for bi-annual company meetings, is required.
  
Experience / Qualifications
  • Positive attitude, solutions-focused, and open to feedback
  • Aptitude for growth and adaptation
  • Excellent written and face-to-face communication skills
  • Detail oriented and a self-starter in managing a list of tasks through to completion
  • 2-3 years of professional experience in Information Technology and/or Technical Support
  • Up-to-date technical knowledge with Cloud based tools and systems
  • An ability to assess each customer/employee's IT knowledge levels and message accordingly
 
Nice-To-Haves
  • Previous proven experience in a fully-remote work environment
  • Experience with Mac operating systems
  • Experience with Security and Compliance protocols
 
Educational Guidelines
Bachelor’s degree in an Information Technology program or the equivalent combination of education, training, or work experience.

Who We Need (Intangibles) 
  • Passionate about health and fitness
  • Desires to have a role in the growth of a startup 
  • Stays motivated and knows how to be persistent
  • Is inquisitive and curious
  • Is self-directed with great problem solving skills
  • Highly organized and able to balance multiple projects and priorities
  • Can work remotely and make decisions autonomously at a high level
  • Flexibility to handle changing responsibilities
  • Exercises sound judgement in the approaches taken to solving technical issues, projecting confidence, and building trust
  • Comfortable acting as a face of Product Technology Operations to both internal staff and occasionally external customers
  • Capable of balancing and prioritizing many different tasks through good time management and expectation setting
  • Not afraid to ask for help or escalate when support is needed, ready to take accountability when things go wrong, and able to drive improvement towards better future outcomes 

What You Get
  • The opportunity to help expand the impact of Peerfit across the United States…and, someday, the world!
  • The chance to work in a relaxed, yet goal-driven start-up culture with a passion for fitness
  • Peerfit credits to attend fitness classes.
  • Chance to work remotely with flexible scheduling
  • Health insurance & other benefits

Peerfit is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our recruiting and hiring processes are free of discrimination based on race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information or any other protected group status as defined by law. To request assistance or accommodation with the application process, email us at careers@peerfit.com.

items.title: Retriever: Remote Operations Specialist
items.content:
Remote Operations Specialist

-----------------------------------------
The Role:
-----------------------------------------
We're excited to be bringing on a full-time, remote operations specialist. This role is 
- one part operations, 
- one part administrative, and
- one part customer service

Operations: 
- Sending out messages to prospective customers (“prospects”)
Customer Service: 
- Responding to messages from those prospects: answering their questions, and telling them more about the services they’re being offered.
Administrative: 
- Scheduling meetings between interested prospects and salespeople who will pitch them on the phone.

As the front-line of communication, you'll have tremendous influence to shape the customer experience for these prospective customers.

-----------------------------------------
Skills / requirements:
-----------------------------------------
- Phenomenal written communication.
Most of your job will be drafting, sending, and responding to emails: answering questions, handling objections, and building trust with prospective clients.

- Attention to detail.
On a daily basis, you'll be juggling calendars, conversations and to-dos all day. So, if you're a natural task-master extraordinaire, we'd love to talk! If you don't sweat the details, this position is not a good fit for you!

- Hustle and passion.
We are a team of "A-Players". We are passionate and driven to work hard and build a product that people love.

- High standard of quality.
We take pride in our work product, and we expect the same of you.

- Comfortable in a fast-pace, fast-changing work environment.
You'll need to be comfortable working in a fast-changing environment. We're a young, agile company. So your workflow is subject to change. If this is exciting — instead of scary — then we'd love to chat :)

-----------------------------------------
About Retriever:
-----------------------------------------

The best products don't always "sell themselves". That's why companies partner with us. We build out their sales funnels: getting more leads, setting more meetings, and closing more deals!

Retriever was started by Silicon Valley startup veterans who have built companies backed by the top silicon valley investors.

Visit our website to learn more! http://www.kindretriever.com

-----------------------------------------
More on the role
-----------------------------------------
- This position is full-time, fully remote (work from anywhere!), and on a contract basis (1099 vs W-2).
- And we'd need you to be able to work North American hours (9AM - 6PM MST).
- We’re looking for teammates who would like to put down roots in a company: to learn and grow together.
