items.title: Peerfit: Cloud Infrastructure Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=8, other=1, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=8, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Cloud Infrastructure Engineer

Company: Peerfit
Headquarters: Tampa, FL
Visit company website

Not open to outside recruiting firms. Applicants please apply here. Please do not send resumes directly to any hiring manager.

Peerfit
Interested in working for a team of people completely redefining how fitness and health care work together? At Peerfit, we’re flipping wellness reimbursements on their head by connecting insurers’ and employers’ wellness dollars to popular fitness studios offering CrossFit, yoga, barre, boot camp, cycling, and more. If working with a team of innovative and driven people who are modernizing how people engage with wellness excites you, look no further than Peerfit.

POSITION SUMMARY:
As a Cloud Infrastructure Engineer you'll be a key member of our Technology Operations team, helping to ensure the reliability and automation of our cloud infrastructure. Your objectives will include:
  • Working alongside a team operating our core cloud infrastructure, using Kubernetes in a GCP / GKE environment.
  • Being regarded as a core member of our infrastructure team: exhibiting empathy, ownership, collaboration, and “humble confidence.” 
  • Collaborating and Sharing knowledge: we expect you to share your skills and knowledge with other technical staff in order to increase the competency and performance of the team as a whole.
  • On-call schedule: we share an on-call rotation that seeks to balance the needs of supporting a production system with the need for technical staff to disconnect from work on reliable schedules.
  • Support the implementation of the organization's security and compliance measures.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
You will be responsible for managing the infrastructure to support the engineering team with the platforms necessary to drive the business' continued growth. You will partner frequently with the software engineering teams at Peerfit to enable continuous improvements in our software shipping methods. You'll collaborate with peers through pairing, code reviews, and team-wide initiatives.

EXPERIENCE/QUALIFICATIONS:
  • 3-5 years of professional experience managing digital technologies on IaaS, having experience with Kubernetes.
  • Experience with infrastructure automation tools such as Terraform.
  • Experience with CI / Automation tools such as Gitlab, CircleCI, Travis.
  • Experienced in writing approachable, well-encapsulated code whose intentions are clear to other contributors and well-suited for extension and change.
  • 1 or more years working in an on-call environment.
  • Ability to travel periodically for bi-annual company all-hands meetings.

NICE TO HAVES:
  • Strong command of open source tooling including bash, vim, tmux, awk
  • Experience with Django, Rails, mysql, redis, celery/rabbitmq
  • Experience with issue management and code quality tools (e.g. Sentry, CodeClimate)
  • General knowledge of software architectural patterns, such as domain-driven design patterns, SOLID principles, the 12-factor app methodology and when they should be applied.

EDUCATIONAL GUIDELINES:
Bachelor’s degree in an information/comp-sci program or the equivalent combination of education, training, or work experience.

WHO WE NEED: (Intangibles) 
  • Passionate about health and fitness
  • Desires to have a role in the growth of a startup 
  • Stays motivated and knows how to be persistent
  • Is self-directed
  • Enjoys collaborating and working with others in a team environment
  • Can work remotely and make decisions autonomously at a high level
  • Flexibility to handle changing responsibilities

WHAT YOU GET:
  • The opportunity to help expand the impact of Peerfit across the United States…and, someday, the world!
  • The chance to work in a relaxed, yet goal-driven start-up culture with a passion for fitness
  • Peerfit credits to attend fitness classes.
  • Chance to work remotely with flexible scheduling
  • Health Insurance & other benefits

Peerfit is an AA/Equal Opportunity Employer
Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans

items.content:
DevOps Engineer at Horizon Solar Power

Remote

Location: Oakland CA US

Sungevity is looking for a full time DevOps Engineer to join our Software Team. This can be a telecommute role from anywhere within the continental USA–or if you reside in the San Francisco Bay Area, Kansas City area, or Inland Empire, you can mix remote work with some time in the local office.

You will own the setup and improvement of all high-availability environments that support our complex software platform, and will play a crucial role in product scoping, roadmap and architecture discussions. Your proficiency in Jenkins/AWS/Docker and your problem-solving mindset are key to troubleshooting and stabilizing our existing environment, allowing us to support business needs that are driving rapid growth of the company.

Duties

  • Troubleshoot and update Platform provisioning code for Test, UAT, and Production environments
  • Release major software features to production
  • Design and test disaster recovery plans and technologies
  • Respond to on-call service alerts
  • Participate in engineering team success through code contribution, collaboration, and consultation
  • Manage ephemeral infrastructure service resources through code-based automation

Competencies:

  • Enthusiastic and self-directed problem solver with the curiosity to explore and resolve complex issues
  • Ability to effectively organize and prioritize
  • Ability to work well in teams and work with peers to ensure successful project delivery
  • Exemplary listening and communication skills, both written and verbally

Skills:

  • Jenkins, Docker, AWS (EBS, RDS, EC2, VPCs, Cloudwatch, IAM), Ant, GitHub, JFrog Artifactory
  • Additional desirable skills: MySQL, MongoDB, exposure to Salesforce and/or NetSuite, Jira, Confluence
  • Strong aptitude for provisioning cloud-based infrastructure via API in AWS
  • Scripting/coding experience in one or more languages, especially Python, Javascript, Scala, Java
  • Expertise at the Linux CLI

Qualifications:

  • Bachelors degree in Information Systems or other technical field
  • Must have 2-5 years of experience working as a DevOps Engineer or Cloud Engineer
  • Must have Jenkins, AWS, and Docker experience in a production environment

Benefits:

  • Competitive base salary
  • Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k and Paid Time Off/Company Holidays
  • Telecommute from anywhere within the Continental USA

Note: Must be able to work legally within the USA.

items.title: Building Management Systems Support Engineer
items.content:
Building Management Systems Support Engineer

United Kingdom, Cheshire
Company: SSE

Overview

Location: Altrincham, Greater Manchester

Salary: Excellent Package including bonus and company car or cash allowance + excellent benefits

The Role

Due to an increase in workload across the North West area and an internal promotion, we currently have a requirement for an experienced BEMS Support Engineer to join our team in Altrincham. This is a fantastic opportunity for a highly motivated BMS Engineer to join a dynamic and growing team.

The role is varied and no two days are ever the same as you could be carrying out scheduled maintenance activities one day at a major hospital to upgrading controller at a pharmaceutical site or initiating an energy reduction initiative the next.

We are a regional business and as such it’s expected that you will be working within the North West, so if you are looking to reduce your time away from home and long days through travel then this could be the perfect opportunity. There is also an excellent bonus structure in place that pays out twice per year!

In the in this role you will be responding to various customer service calls. Whether they be emergency or scheduled, on site or remotely you’ll carry out full checks, analyse and diagnose problems through testing system components, allowing you to discuss the best course of action with your customers. You’ll be confident in identifying actions/equipment required and providing timescales around the resolution and highlighting any potential improvement or upgrade opportunities. There’s some paperwork involved as your customers will expect to receive written service reports & field quotes on a daily basis; and your line manager will require timesheets and other necessary weekly information (like expenses) which must be delivered in a timely manner

Your Experience

Excellent communication skills are essential to maintain a collaborative working environment with all stakeholders including customer and external service providers. It is expected you’ll display a professional manner and a dedication to meeting customer expectations, including delivering technical support, coaching and direction. You’ll be working in an ever changing environment and as such will be adaptable and flexible as there is a requirement to take part in a 24 hour on-call rota currently every seven weeks.

It will be essential that the successful candidate is highly experienced in Tridium. Experience in Trend and / or Siemens BMS would also be highly beneficial and you will ideally be familiar with the following building control systems; Schneider Electric, Delta, Honeywell, Johnson Controls, or Cylon.

As site based travel will be a factor in this role, it is essential that applicants have a full and valid UK driver’s license.

Our Company

Energy Solutions, our energy optimisation division – helps businesses achieve reductions in their buildings’ energy consumption through the design, maintenance and optimisation of their Building Management Systems.

Our Benefits

We have an excellent benefits package as part of our offering. Here’s a few highlights;

– Home based (travelling appointment)

– Generous holiday allowance (you can even buy additional holidays)

– Great share plans

– Group Pension Plan

– One day paid volunteering

– Tailored internal development opportunities

Next Steps

Just click the Apply button to submit your application, it doesn’t take long.

Closing date for applications is: 30th May 2019

This vacancy is open to internal and external candidates. If you’re internal, please notify your line manager before you submit your application. If you’re successful, we’ll conduct some pre-employment checks

Apply for job

items.content:
Senior Communications Systems Engineer (Active TS/SCI Security Clearan

United States, Virginia
Company: Peraton

Overview

Overview
Peraton is seeking a Senior Communications Systems Engineer with experience in wireless communications systems to join a dynamic engineering team in development and deployment of state-of-the-art communications and signal processing systems, including satellite ground terminals.

Responsibilities
What you’ll do…

  • Develop requirements documentation.
  • Support analysis and allocation of requirements to lower level systems.
  • Coordinate with external customers.
  • Support design and requirements reviews.
  • Develop, maintain and exercise system performance models
  • Identifying critical analysis required, organizing and performing analysis tasks, organizing and performing system- and design-level trades, developing and evaluating algorithms, defining system architecture to implement algorithm
  • Requirements verification planning and execution;
  • Support business development, development of system engineering and analysis program plans.
  • Develop concepts of operation, technical planning, system integration, verification and validation, cost and risk, supportability and effectiveness analyses, functional analysis, timeline analysis, detailed trade studies
  • Ensure the logical and systematic conversion of customer or product requirements into total systems solutions that acknowledge technical, schedule, and cost constraints.
Qualifications
You’d be a great fit if you have…

  • Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering
  • Over 8 years of experience in systems architecture and requirements development applicable to wireless digital communications systems
  • The ability to communicate and work well with others
  • Strong writing and presentation skills

It’d be even better if you have…

  • Advanced degree in Electrical Engineering
  • Possess strong analytical skills
  • Familiarity with signal processing techniques/algorithms
  • Experience with Matlab / Simulink / Octave / STK
  • Automated test environments

What you’ll get…

  • An immediately-vested 401(K) with employer matching
  • Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage
  • Rapid PTO accrual schedule with floating holidays
  • Tuition assistance, financing, and refinancing
  • Company-paid infertility treatments
  • Cross-training and professional development opportunities
  • Paid maternity and paternity leave
  • The ability to influence major initiatives and make a measurable impact

Security Clearance…

This position requires the candidate to have an active TS/SCI security clearance and to maintain the clearance.

About Peraton
Are you ready to join the next-generation of national security? Peraton is a fresh name in the industry with an established portfolio and legacy going back more than a century. We work differently than our peers – with agility, the freedom to innovate, an entrepreneurial spirit and a culture of responsibility. As part of the Peraton team, you’ll be part of our movement to build a great company, solve the most daunting challenges facing mankind today, to protect and promote freedom around the world, and to secure our future, for our families, our communities, our nation, and our way of life.

EEO Statement
We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We consider applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, ancestry, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, disability, genetic information, citizenship status, or membership in any other group protected by federal, state, or local law.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=16, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Satellite Systems Engineer

United States, Virginia
Company: Peraton

Overview

Overview
Peraton is seeking a Satellite Systems Engineer for a classified program to analyze, consult, and makes recommendations for specifying, acquiring, operating, and maintaining earth terminal satellite systems and satellite bandwidth.

Responsibilities
Responsibilities include:

  • Design, develop, evaluate and modify end-to-end earth terminal satellite systems through their entire life cycle.
  • T ranslate high level product development strategies into system requirement specifications and work with multi-discipline engineering teams to develop lower level detailed requirements.
  • Design interfaces and bring system elements together so they work as a whole. Assess performance using evaluation criteria and technical performance measures.
  • Participate in design reviews of components (hardware and software) to ensure applicability to the current system and traceability of requirements through compliance verification and validation. Generate system level requirements verification procedures and customer acceptance test procedures.
  • Review test plans/procedures and ensure they meet the objectives of the contractual requirements and participate in the testing process to validate requirements.
Qualifications
QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Requires Bachelor’s (or equivalent) with 5 – 8 years of experience, or a Master’s and 3 to 5 years of experience.
  • Working experience designing, developing, evaluating and modifying end-to-end earth terminal satellite systems through their entire life cycle.
  • Current TS/SCI with poly clearance .
About Peraton
Are you ready to join the next-generation of national security? Peraton is a fresh name in the industry with an established portfolio and legacy going back more than a century. We work differently than our peers – with agility, the freedom to innovate, an entrepreneurial spirit and a culture of responsibility. As part of the Peraton team, you’ll be part of our movement to build a great company, solve the most daunting challenges facing mankind today, to protect and promote freedom around the world, and to secure our future, for our families, our communities, our nation, and our way of life.

We consider applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, ancestry, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, disability, genetic information, citizenship status, or membership in any other group protected by federal, state, or local law.

items.title: Bitovi: SRE and DevOps Consultant
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=1, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
SRE and DevOps Consultant

Company: Bitovi
Headquarters: Chicago, IL
Visit company website

ABOUT BITOVI:

Bitovi helps companies create better web applications.  

We have a track record of designing and building high-profile and amazing applications through our active Consulting practice.  Our apps are built with tests, full docs, and a deployment process in place.

Bitovi has been a pioneer in producing advanced frameworks and tools for almost a decade. We develop and maintain several open source products such as CanJS, DoneJS, and StealJS to name a few.  We are interested in product innovation and opportunities.

Our team is comprised of about 30ish developers and designers located around the US and Canada. This is a remote full-time opportunity.  We are looking for candidates located in the US or Canada as occasional travel may be required.

 


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR:

We are looking for qualified individuals with the following:
  • BS (or equivalent) in relevant field (computer science, etc)
  • 5+ years experience in a professional cloud computing role
  • Thorough understanding of the full CI/CD pipeline
  • Thorough understanding of Observability in DevOps
  • Experience integrating with at least one enterprise auth system (SAML, LDAP, etc)
  • Ability to solve complex problems
  • Ability to take an abstract goal from idea to reality with little to no guidance
  • Ability to keep track of any number of simultaneous initiatives with detailed clarity and efficiency
  • Familiarity with StackStorm

Individuals should also be an expert with:
  • Deploying and maintaining production, enterprise applications to a Kubernetes cluster
  • GitOps workflows
  • At least one configuration management tool
  • Automating systems through configuration
  • Using the Prometheus/Grafana/Alertmanager stack in a production environment
  • Using Helm
  • Writing and publishing Docker containers
  • Writing bash scripts
  • At least 2 programming languages (one should be Python)
  • Communication and setting expectations
 

THE JOB:

You'll act as a consultant with our client, and we expect the role to include the following:
  • Configure and maintain Prometheus, Grafana, and Alertmanager instances as well as StackStorm instances deployed into Kubernetes clusters using industry best practices such as infrastructure-as-code and GitOps.
  • Write PromQL queries to answer complex questions about entities being monitored
  • Build and maintain Grafana dashboards
  • Configure Alertmanager to notify and work with external systems
  • Write StackStorm packs to handle alerts from Alertmanager and other systems and to perform diagnostic and remediation actions/workflows
  • Work with other team members to keep all systems up-to-date with latest upstream versions and install supplemental tools as required by client.
  • Interact with the client’s internal customers directly to address concerns and requests.
  • Enhance workflows (developmental and technological) based on conversations with team members and customers
  • Propose and implement enhancements based on independent research and insights
  • Fully own features and ensure they are delivered with high quality
  • Facilitate coordination and collaboration between team members and other teams for assigned features
  • Gather feature requirements and translate them into implementable steps
  • Maintain status reports of all active work including risks, uncertainties, and timelines
 

A LITTLE BIT MORE:

The following attributes are major positives, but not all hard requirements:

  • Experience deploying and managing Kubernetes clusters
  • Experience with StackStorm in Production
  • DevOps tools experience outside of CI/CD
  • Experience writing Helm charts
 

ROLE:  Full Time Hire

Company: Phreesia | Ottawa, ON, Canada

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-05:00) Eastern Time
Office Location: Ottawa, ON, Canada. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

.net
chef
linux
ruby
sysadmin

Job description

Location: Remote (USA or Canada)

Salary Range: We provide competitive compensation packages, including equity for all employees.

Who We Want: 

Do you have a passion for scripting and coding in Chef?

Do you consider yourself a team player who enjoys working with other engineers?

Does the idea of creating innovative solutions for millions of people in healthcare excite you?

Read further!

At Phreesia, our DevOps Engineers play a critical role in partnering with Product Development, Data Center Operations, and QA teams to deliver our SaaS solutions to the world. This individual is responsible for developing build and release frameworks and tools to ensure that software is being correctly built, tested, packaged, and deployed through development, test, and production environments.

What You'll Do:

  • Work with other Development teams to provide a framework for building, testing and packaging their code in a consistent, reusable way
  • Create and support automated processes for deploying and configuring applications in multiple environments using Chef, Atlassian Bamboo, Octopus Deploy and similar tools
  • Create and support applications and APIs to provide insight into application state and integrations with other systems
  • Build and maintain frameworks to allow other internal teams to deploy and provision new resources
  • Work with Team Architects to troubleshoot problems in both the build and deployment process and deployed systems
  • Participate in release/milestone planning and scheduling as part of an Agile development team
  • Learn the US Healthcare system and how customers use our products
  • Deploy .NET based service-oriented web applications into production to a fast-paced deployment schedule

What You'll Need:

  • BS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or Mathematics
  • Overall 5-10 years of experience with at least 3 years experience as asoftware developer
  • Experience designing and implementing tasks in Continuous Integration systems (Bamboo, Cruisecontrol.net, Jenkins,etc.)
  • Experience designing and implementing workflows with Artifact Management systems (Proget, Artifactory, etc)
  • Experience with supporting application deployments to AWS
  • Experience with infrastructure management tools (Terraform, VMware, etc)
  • Windows Server and IIS setup and troubleshooting experience
  • Experience with PowerShell
  • Git repository management experience

Technical Knowledge:

  • Development experience with Ruby and Chef
  • Experience with Windows and Linuxadministration

Who We Are: 

At Phreesia, we’re committed to helping healthcare organizations succeed in a fast-changing landscape—and we need smart, passionate people to help us do it. Our innovative SaaS platform offers our clients a suite of applications to manage the intake process, giving them the tools to engage patients, improve efficiency, optimize staffing and enhance clinical care. Our solutions are in all 50 states, and we check in 70 million patients a year!  

Basically, what you are doing here matters and hard work does not go unnoticed. Not only does Phreesia care about our clients we also care about our employees. We are proud to say that we have grown 40% each year and consistently continue to do so. If you crave working with driven and engaged colleagues, a structured sales process, consistent recognition, defined career path, and enjoy working in revamped new areas, this may be the right opportunity for you.  

Benefits and Perks: 

  • Variety of health plan options, dental/ vision coverage, and short/long-term and life insurance plans 401(k) savings plan
  • Flexible working hours
  • Unlimited vacation
  • Unlimited snacks and drinks in our offices
  • Mobile phone stipends, monthly subway pass reimbursement and Internet reimbursement
  • 100% paid maternity leave to our U.S. employees, as well as a generous maternity benefit to our employees in Canada
  • Tuition and certification reimbursement, as well as other professional development opportunities

We strive to provide a diverse and inclusive environment and are an equal opportunity employer.

Apply now

About Phreesia

Leading healthcare organizations choose Phreesia to revolutionize their point of service. Regardless of size, specialty or demographics, today’s healthcare systems face the same challenges: escalating demands, rising costs and increasing patient responsibility. Phreesia’s innovative point-of-service platform—including patient self-service and mobile applications—resolves these issues by driving efficiency and profitability throughout your organization. Your patients expect a seamless, automated experience from other industries. Why should your front office be any different?

Benefits

  • Unlimited Paid Time Off
  • Snacks
  • Full medical benefits
  • Maternity Leave
  • Work Stations/Laptops
  • Gym reimbursement
  • Travel reimbursement
  • Data reimbursement
  • 401K
  • Paternity leave

Senior DevOps Engineer (US Timezone, Remote, Contract)

About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Senior
Role: DevOps
Industry: Software Consulting, Software Development / Engineering, Web Technology
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Reactions to this job

0 0 0 0 0 0
New! How do you feel about this job listing?
Company: NearForm | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-07:00) Mountain Time +/- 4 hours

Technologies

ansible
amazon-web-services
kubernetes
terraform
docker

Job description

What will your day look like?

Turn on your monitor and join the hangout for your daily standup. There are some GitHub pull requests that need your attention, time to put your Ansible hat on. Lunchtime - you go and meet some friends at your favourite cafe. When you get back to your desk, your Terraform environment has finished provisioning and you kick off some smoke tests on your Kubernetes cluster. Then it’s back to your earlier automation work. Before you know it, it’s time to close the laptop.

What will you be doing?

At NearForm, we work with international clients who are industry leaders in their respective fields. Our role is to help them build solutions and platforms; help them to launch new product ventures and fundamentally change how they operate.

Join a highly skilled multidisciplinary team; typically consisting of designers, front-end and back-end experts, DevOps engineers, and also members of the client team. This mix follows a modern agile development methodology where we run 2-week sprints with a defined backlog, daily standups, weekly demos, sprint planning and sprint retros; all with as little ceremony as necessary.

What do we ask of you?

  • 6+ years experience developing at an enterprise level
  • Modern DevOps mindset using best of breed open source tools and technologies, including, Terraform and Ansible
  • Experience working with containers and container orchestration, including, Docker and Kubernetes
  • Experience managing and automating real-world platforms/applications on AWS
  • Experience with Continuous Integration and the building of continuous delivery pipelines
  • Security awareness throughout the stack
  • Data storage experience with RDBMS and NoSQL technologies
  • US or South American Timezone
  • Availability for short-term travel on a semi-regular basis
  • Fluent English and outstanding communication skills (written and oral)

What will you get?

  • Work/Life balance: we have a genuine dedication to work/life balance.
  • Family friendly: we understand how important family is, so our flexible environment allows you to work around what matters - school run, no problem!
  • The Wellness Hub: we offer resources and support and have a genuine commitment to fostering/improving NearFormer’s wellbeing.
  • Knowledge perks: explore new hobbies, brush up on life skills or simply learn something new, there is something there for everyone.  
  • NearFest: we all get together in person at our annual company retreat

Why do you want to join the team?

We adopt a person-first approach to hiring. That means we hire the best people – it’s as simple as that. Our lucky HR team gets to pick the cream of the crop from around the world and has brought together a collection of dynamic and talented individuals we like to call ‘NearFormers’.

Although we are widely dispersed, NearFormers are a tightly-knit team. We trust one another and care about our colleagues. Building on our open source origins, we promote the sharing of thoughts, knowledge and ideas.

NearForm is committed to shaping a better world in all that we do. Our global team is built based on respect, inclusivity, diversity and excellence.

Apply now

About NearForm

NearForm is working to shape a better world with open, creative software. NearForm is committed to shaping a better world in all that we do. Our global team is built based on respect, inclusivity, diversity and excellence – and we’d love you to join us.

Benefits

  • Best People: we hire the best people from all over the world
  • Open Source: we aim to make significant contributions to Open Source
  • Work/Life Balance: we have a genuine commitment to work-life balance
  • Flexible: we support a schedule that fits your style
  • Family-Friendly: we offer parental and maternity leave, flexible hours
  • Location: join us at HQ and go for a surf at lunch time
  • Work Remotely: you don't have to be at HQ, work wherever suits you
  • The Wellness Hub: we offer resources and support for your wellbeing

Remote details

Office Location: Toronto, ON, Canada. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

cloud
puppet
kubernetes
ruby
containers
sysadmin

Job description

We are currently seeking a Systems Engineer, Production to join our rapidly expanding team. This role can be performed from one of our offices (Vancouver, Calgary, Toronto) or remotely. 

Founded in Vancouver, Canada in 2008, Clio is transforming the practice of law, for good. Whether it's our industry-leading cloud-based practice management platform, our ground-breaking Legal Trends Report or our ever-popular Clio Cloud Conference, Clio is at the forefront of advancing the legal sphere.

With the help of the cloud, we make lawyers’ lives simpler and help them better organize and manage their legal practices. As one of Canada’s fastest-growing companies with international reach, we employ over 250 individuals with a rapidly growing customer base spanning 90 countries. Clio has been recognized as one of CIX’s Top 20 Most Influential Technology Companies, one of Canada’s Top Small & Medium Employers, and has one of Canada’s 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures.

Who you are:

  • You are a self-starting and self-governing learner and worker who is adept at breaking down intractable problems into achievable pieces and iterating on them.
  • You are curious by nature and love to dig deep on problems, always asking “Why?”.
  • You communicate in a clear and concise manner, regardless of medium (text, voice, and in-person).
  • You are a rational and critical thinker, with an inclination for evidence-based decision making.
  • You have strong opinions that are weakly held.
  • You have a team-first mentality and will naturally step in to support co-workers when you perceive them to be in difficulty.

What you'll be doing:

  • You will be creating, improving, and maintaining a globally distributed mesh of Clio service regions that acts as a foundation for each of our clients across the world to excel within their respective jurisdictions.
  • You will be nurturing and evolving the development ecosystem at Clio by providing the tools, infrastructure, and services that our developers rely on to transform the practice of law, for good.
  • You’ll be recognizing opportunities for process improvement or automation and then writing clean, maintainable code in order to erase the manual task or nullify the pain point.

What you should have:

  • Experience writing clean, maintainable scripts, services, and utilities both for your own personal use as well as for distribution to other users (specific experience in Ruby, Shell, or Go considered an asset).
  • Experience administering Debian GNU/Linux systems and networks (specific experience with Puppet considered an asset).
  • Experience holistically administering MySQL (everything from configuring the underlying filesystem to tuning SQL queries and schema design).
  • Experience working with the common cloud providers (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) as well as with bare hardware.
Apply now

About Clio

Why Clio?

We could talk to you about our ping pong table, beer taps, yoga classes, and nap room, but, we know you’re looking for more than that. Instead, here are a few of the things that set us apart and make us the employer of choice for top talent in Canada and beyond:

  • The chance to do work that matters on a product that truly changes lives. This is the place for driven people who want to make their mark.
  • The freedom to choose your own path (and change it) to build a meaningful career that works for you.
  • Excellent health and dental coverage, vacation time, parental leave options and education spending
  • An RRSP matching program
  • Regular games nights and team outings with the best co-workers you’ll ever work with

Diversity and Inclusion

We believe that ensuring diversity and inclusion will produce a better place to work and a better product. We encourage all candidates to apply.

Benefits

  • An amazing team of devs
  • Competitive salary
  • Some of the best equipment available
  • On-premise wellness classes
  • Dog-friendly office
  • Flexible hours
  • 3 weeks of vacation
  • Extended health benefits

Remote details

Technologies

devops
linux

amazon-web-services

Job description

Hirestarter's client is an exciting Austin based startup that makes analytics and collaboration software for top retailers. They leverage data science to deliver intelligent, cloud-based software platforms and applications to some of the biggest players in the automotive and retail sectors. 

They have a great culture and solid team and provide flexibility and competitive packages including equity. 

Looking for a Senior DevOps engineer to handle the demands of their customers. Our client platform is continually evolving, and they are working to provide more scale and automation to keep up with their customer and feature growth.

Their DevOps engineering team works with software development teams to instill a culture of DevOps and builds shared components that make all teams faster and more successful. 

We’re looking for someone excited to work with modern technologies in startup culture, looking to have an immediate impact, and ready to rise to the challenge of a growing organization. 


Responsibilities

Design and build enterprise-scale SaaS infrastructure to stay ahead of growing usage, planning for scalability, high availability, and low maintenance cost 
Collaborate with software engineering and data engineering 
Automate processes with a DevOps mindset, building infrastructure as code. 
Use containerization, orchestration, configuration management, and deployment automation. 
Share best practices and mentor other Engineers in the areas where you're an expert 
Continuing to learn and grow, you’ll pick up new technologies and patterns as the product and industry evolve. While experience with these tools is not required, you’ll be working with AWS and Azure, Terraform, Docker, Chef, Jenkins, Kafka, ELK, and Datadog. 

About You 
Deep experience running web apps at scale 
You're a coder, not an administrator. You don't manage one server at a time; you build frameworks for configuring and monitoring them 
You have opinions on what makes a good DevOps tech stack, but you know that tech is dynamic so you don't limit yourself to just one approach 
You're a thoughtful communicator, positive, with a bias for action 

Apply now

About Hirestarter

Hirestarter is a startup tech recruiting boutique firm in Austin. Hirestarter's client is an exciting Austin based startup that leverages data science to deliver intelligent, cloud-based software platforms and applications to some of the biggest players in the automotive and retail sectors. 

They have a great culture and solid team and provide flexibility and competitive packages including equity.

Remote details

Technologies

c
linux
docker
Matthew Flaschen 225k 37 446 504
Dmitry Brant Senior Software Engineer, Product Owner (Android) at Wikimedia Foundation 6.4k 2 25 44
Arthur Richards
Monte Hurd 2.2k 4 24 34

Job description

Summary:

Come work within the Technology department at the Wikimedia Foundation! We are administering a public OpenStack cloud (Infrastructure as a Service) with a modern Platform as a Service (Kubernetes) running on it. We are dedicated to supporting developers within and outside of the Wikimedia Foundation. Candidates need to be comfortable sharing ideas, providing guidance, following instructions, mentoring volunteers, and communicating in public and asynchronous ways (mailing lists/forums/irc). Our team works remotely and so can you!

Responsibilities:

  • Perform day-to-day operational tasks on Wikimedia’s Cloud Services infrastructure (deployment, maintenance, configuration, troubleshooting)
  • Support volunteer and staff developers using Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) and Platform as a Service (PaaS) products
  • Assist in the architectural design of new services and making them operate at scale
  • Assist in or lead incident response, diagnosis and followup on system outages or alerts across our stack
  • On-call support and off-hours coverage in a 24x7 environment

Qualifications:

  • Mid to senior level engineering mindset and experience in Linux ecosystems
  • Experience offering first line technical support to peers and/or customers
  • Solid development history with interpreted languages (Python preferred)
  • Capable of explaining the basic operations of TCP/IP networks
  • Experience operating an elastic computing environment for customers (OpenStack, Cloudstack, ...)
  • Experience running Docker and/or container technologies in a production environment
  • Demonstrable experience developing and debugging web applications
  • Experience using a configuration management platform such as Puppet
  • Strong verbal and written proficiency with the English language
  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent in work experience

Pluses:

  • Experience interacting with open source software projects and communities
  • Experience with Kubernetes, Docker Swarm, Mesos, or similar container orchestration platforms
  • Experience with Golang
  • Ceph or other storage management experience
  • Low level systems troubleshooting and debugging skills (CPU/memory profiling, C/C++ experience, in-depth Linux knowledge)

The Wikimedia Foundation is... 

...the nonprofit organization that hosts and operates Wikipedia and the other Wikimedia free knowledge projects. Our vision is a world in which every single human can freely share in the sum of all knowledge. We believe that everyone has the potential to contribute something to our shared knowledge, and that everyone should be able to access that knowledge, free of interference. We host the Wikimedia projects, build software experiences for reading, contributing, and sharing Wikimedia content, support the volunteer communities and partners who make Wikimedia possible, and advocate for policies that enable Wikimedia and free knowledge to thrive. The Wikimedia Foundation is a charitable, not-for-profit organization that relies on donations. We receive financial support from millions of individuals around the world, with an average donation of about $15. We also receive donations through institutional grants and gifts. The Wikimedia Foundation is a United States 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization with offices in San Francisco, California, USA.

The Wikimedia Foundation is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply

U.S. Benefits & Perks*

  • Fully paid medical, dental and vision coverage for employees and their eligible families (yes, fully paid premiums!)

  • The Wellness Program provides reimbursement for mind, body and soul activities such as fitness memberships, baby sitting, continuing education and much more

  • The 401(k) retirement plan offers matched contributions at 4% of annual salary

  • Flexible and generous time off - vacation, sick and volunteer days, plus 19 paid holidays - including the last week of the year.

  • Family friendly! 100% paid new parent leave for seven weeks plus an additional five weeks for pregnancy, flexible options to phase back in after leave, fully equipped lactation room.

  • For those emergency moments - long and short term disability, life insurance (2x salary) and an employee assistance program

  • Pre-tax savings plans for health care, child care, elder care, public transportation and parking expenses

  • Telecommuting and flexible work schedules available

  • Appropriate fuel for thinking and coding (aka, a pantry full of treats) and monthly massages to help staff relax

  • Great colleagues - diverse staff and contractors speaking dozens of languages from around the world, fantastic intellectual discourse, mission-driven and intensely passionate people

*Eligible international workers' benefits are specific to their location and dependent on their employer of record

More information

Wikimedia Foundation website

Wikimedia Foundation blog

Annual Report - 2017

Wikimedia 2030

Apply now

About Wikimedia Foundation, Inc.

The Wikimedia Foundation is...

...the nonprofit organization that supports Wikipedia and the other Wikimedia free knowledge projects. Our vision is a world in which every single human can freely share in the sum of all knowledge. We believe that everyone has the potential to contribute something to our shared knowledge, and that everyone should be able to access that knowledge, free of interference. We host the Wikimedia projects, build software experiences for reading, contributing, and sharing Wikimedia content, support the volunteer communities and partners who make Wikimedia possible, and advocate for policies that enable Wikimedia and free knowledge to thrive. The Wikimedia Foundation is a charitable, not-for-profit organization that relies on donations. We receive financial support from millions of individuals around the world, with an average donation of about $15. We also receive donations through institutional grants and gifts. The Wikimedia Foundation is a United States 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization with offices in San Francisco, California, USA.

The Wikimedia Foundation is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply.

Benefits

  • Fully paid premiums for medical, dental & vision insurance premiums
  • 401(k) with 4% matching contribution
  • 7-12 weeks parental leave with 100% pay + lactation room
  • Wellness Program ($1800 annual) to promote wellness & personal growth
  • Pre-tax savings plans for Transportation & Parking
  • Flexible work schedules and remote working options
  • Pet Friendly office
  • Commitment to diversity & inclusion throughout the employee lifecycle
  • 12 days vacation, 19 days holiday, 2 days volunteer work and more!
  • Lean more at https://wikimediafoundation.org/wiki/Work_with_us

items.content:
System Admin Office IT (m/f/d)

Company: Raisin
Location: Berlin, DE
Level: Intermediate
Language: English
Maintenance & Support
Skills:
  • Amazon Web Services (AWS)
  • Network Administration
  • SaaS

    • Intro

    We are a dynamic, successful, and fast growing FinTech company based in Berlin, that aims to making savings and investments digitally accessible to improve customer benefit. Our goal is to provide customers all over Europe with simple, secure, and profitable savings and investment products without barriers. We have received more than €170 million in funding from well-known investors including Thrive Capital, Ribbit Capital, Index Ventures, Yuri Milner, Tom Stafford and PayPal.

    Our platform is available in English across Europe alongside country-specific platforms in Germany, France, Spain, Austria, UK, and the Netherlands. We are one of the leading FinTech companies in Europe, with more than 170,000 satisfied customers and exceeding €12 billion in assets invested via the Raisin platforms, and have featured in The FinTech50 in 2016, 2017, and 2018.

    The responsibilities of the role include;

    • Administrate your colleagues' MacOS, Microsoft Windows or Linux client computers (MacBook, laptops)
    • Provide software updates and patches whenever needed
    • Take over responsibility for timely hardware and software orders
    • Support your colleagues in software related questions
    • Take care of our network infrastructure, printers, and everything related to it
    • Create, implement, and maintain documentations 
    • Manage different external stakeholders 
    • Work on various internal projects with your colleagues


    Main requirements

    • You have successfully accomplished your practical education in the field of computer science, networks, or a similar field
    • You have solid work experience (min. 3 years) in client administration related to MacOS/Microsoft/Linux
    • Good knowledge of networks (IPv4/IPv6/switches/router/firewall/VPN) and VoIP
    • Experience in software deployment and patch management
    • Experience in SaaS and Cloud-Systems e.g. AWS
    • You are a service oriented team player
    • Excellent English skills, German is a plus



    Perks

    • Relocation and visa support as well as a relocation reimbursement
    • Personal training budget of 1,500 € and four full training days
    • Free choice of hardware
    • Beginner German classes directly at the office and financial support for acquiring a language certificate 
    • Hungry all the time? Breakfast, snacks, daily fresh fruit as well as drinks are provided
    • Stay up to date at regular townhall sessions with our founders and feel free to ask any kinds of questions
    • Flexible working hours, home office and 28 vacation days 
    • Enjoy more than 50+ different sports with Urban Sports Club: We subsidize your membership with more than 20 € per month 
    • We offer you a company pension scheme (Betriebliche Altersvorsorge), which we support with 20 %
    • Enjoy yearly company retreats to exciting European cities and other team events, such as Lunch Lottery, Tech Lunch, Xletix and Raisin Ladies Events

items.content:
DevOps Engineer (Remote)

Company: TaxJar
Headquarters: Remote
Visit company website

DESCRIPTION


TaxJar’s remote-only team of 80 people is growing quickly. We have an immediate opening for a DevOps Engineer who wants to help us make eCommerce easier for everyone.

Our core values
  • We do the right thing for our customers.
  • We're a team, built on trust.
  • We're proud to be remote.
  • We're in control of our own destiny.

We're looking for a detailed oriented, battle-tested, and knowledgeable DevOps engineer that is eager to make an impact on a game-changing product in eCommerce. Someone that has the passion to build the infrastructure for TaxJar's core services to maintain and exceed our traffic and reliability trajectory.

On our team you will have the opportunity to build and maintain cloud architecture that supports tens of thousands of customers.

*This is a full-time remote position available to folks located in the US.

As a DevOps professional for TaxJar you will
  • Help us maintain high standards for security, stability, and operational best practices
  • Maintain, test, and improve disaster recovery across our technology stacks
  • Build complex deployment pipelines for Ruby and Elixir applications
  • Maintain and improve our monitoring and alerting systems across AWS and Heroku applications
  • Assist in migrating services from Heroku to AWS
  • Be an expert with AWS cloud services; EC2, RDS, IAM, EKS, Developer Tools, etc.
  • Have experience with infrastructure as code using tools such as CloudFormation, Terraform, Ansible, Chef, Puppet, etc.
  • Support the project efforts of all TaxJar development teams


REQUIREMENTS


  • 3 - 6 years of experience in cloud based DevOps with a heavy focus on AWS services
  • Production experience with: CloudFormation, CodeDeploy, Ruby applications, AWS cost optimization, and Postgresql
  • Extensive knowledge of monitoring and operating applications in containers at scale
  • Experience with running disaster recovery scenarios and then documenting and implementing issues that were discovered
  • Ability to write clear and accurate documentation around how infrastructure is laid out and can be modified
  • Be accountable for the infrastructure you are provisioning and maintaining
  • Manage DevOps tasks from assignment through to production
  • Agile, humble, trustworthy, and a team player
  • Rapid learner who thrives in a fast-paced and demanding environment
  • Passion for building simple and intuitive solutions for complex problems in eCommerce
  • Excel at communicating with the team remotely (chat, video, email, etc)

You’ll be a great fit on our team if you
  • Only want to work remotely
  • Are a PRO at communicating and collaboration
  • Highly value working with people you like and respect
  • Are accountable
  • Are confident in your skills and a solid team player (we’re peers here, no egos please) but also comfortable working asynchronously
  • Are hungry to play an impactful role and not afraid to fail

We’re a happy team and we all really love what we do. We've created a space where high-achievers can succeed, but are also safe to fail. We're profitable and focused on growing TaxJar sustainably. We're always learning how to make TaxJar the best place to work for all of us, and not just another tech startup. We’re always looking for an amazing new teammates to come share in the excitement of solving real-world problems with technology.

BENEFITS:

  • Excellent health, vision and dental benefits
  • Flexible vacation policy
  • $1,000 in professional development credit
  • Home office stipend
  • Equity in a profitable company
  • 2x year all-company in person retreats (fully paid for by us of course)
  • Mandatory Birthday holiday!
  • 12 week paid maternity/ 6 week paid paternity leave
  • Monthly perks reimbursement for things like Netflix, Amazon Prime, your gym membership, home internet and more.

We offer all of our employees amazing benefits. Visit www.TaxJar.com/jobs for a full list of our benefits and to learn more about how we work and what we stand for.

If you're not the perfect fit for this position, but you know someone who is, we'll pay you $1,000 if you refer us to the person we hire.

items.title: Invoca: Senior Site Reliability Engineer
items.content:
Senior Site Reliability Engineer

Company: Invoca
Headquarters: Santa Barbara, CA
Visit company website

Invoca offers an unusually valuable engineering experience. You will be part of a team of world-class Operations Engineers deploying code to our production SaaS platform and public cloud infrastructure multiple times per day. Our remote-first team is committed to upholding high standards via modern methodologies of agile software deployment, test-driven development, and DevOps.

What you will do:
  • Work on solutions for challenging problems, including: highly available architecture, large scale data warehouses, scalable and reliable VoIP telephony
  • Exhibit an exceptional diligence to automate processes.
  • Practice sustainable incident response and blameless postmortems.
  • Participate in peer code reviews, design reviews, production on-call rotation, standups, retrospectives, mentoring 1-on-1s, root cause analyses, and more.
  • Focus on the whole production stack; building, maintaining, and monitoring systems that a wide range of internal and external customers are using.

What we are looking for:
  • A systematic problem-solving approach, coupled with strong communication skills and a sense of ownership and drive.
  • Extensive experience within a production environment implementing, troubleshooting, and supporting Linux operating systems, Internet-based applications, and web servers
  • Advanced knowledge of Docker, Kubernetes, and the challenges/benefits associated with containerization.
  • Hands-on experience with Configuration Management (e.g. Chef, Ansible, Puppet) and/or Infrastructure as Code (e.g. Terraform, CloudFormation).
  • A desire to create and write elegant, scalable, and maintainable tools and solutions.

items.title: System Consultant
items.content:
System Consultant at Ultimate Software

Remote
  • Support Services SUPPO05475
  • Full-Time
  • Remote – USA

Job Details

Description

As a System Consultant, you will be called on to perform various roles during the course of post-live cycle for our customers all while maintaining World Class Customer Service. Certain projects will warrant you to provide senior level strategic expertise, while others will require specific product knowledge, data mapping, testing, analytical and design skills. The following is a list of responsibilities that you will have on your various assignments. Some or all may be needed on any project you will be assigned to.

Here at Ultimate Software, we truly put our people first. We strongly believe in teamwork, and we encourage and trust our people to reach higher, learn more, and live up to their potential. Ultimate is ranked #1 on Fortune’s Best Places to Work in Technology for 2019 and #8 on the 100 Best Companies to Work For list in 2019. Ultimate is also ranked #1 on Fortune’s 75 Best Workplaces for Women and #5 on its Best Workplaces for Diversity list.

Primary/Essential Duties and Key Responsibilities:

  • In depth knowledge of the UltiPro Launch methodology & implementation experience
  • Assist customers with various service requests ranging from low to high complexity
  • Manage internal and external customer expectations
  • Provide product and subject matter expertise to customers and to team members
  • Ability to start, analyze, track progress and maintain an assigned project through completion
  • Focus on identifying product and customer knowledge gaps
  • Design and deliver written training recommendations or document additional growth opportunities for our customers based on knowledge obtained from current project
  • Document project work and progress in Salesforce
  • Create and maintain Statement of Work and/or Scope Document and Project Plan for work engagements
  • Write specifications as required and submit to the technical implementation team in a timely manner
  • Provide accurate and timely information regarding project status and project hours into Salesforce/PSA
  • Assist with data mapping from source system(s) to UltiPro for various conversion needs
  • Provide input on methodology and process improvements on team calls
  • Ability to work flexible hours based on customer preference and demand

Preferred Qualifications:

  • A minimum of 5 years of UltiPro activation/implementation experience
  • Excellent product knowledge of UltiPro and working knowledge of additional UltiPro systems/modules.
  • Excellent coaching and feedback skills
  • Excellent communication, presentation and negotiation skills.
  • Excellent problem-solving, decision-making, and relationship building skills.
  • Extremely customer-focused; positive, professional attitude.
  • Foresees potential problems and takes corrective action to ensure achievement of goals.
  • Clear and concise in communicating information. Actively listens to what others are saying, seeking and sharing information.
  • Provides clear direction to the customer and determines if change in approach is needed to accomplish goals.
  • Results driven orientation
  • SQL knowledge is preferred

Educational Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Business Administration, or related field preferred

Physical Requirements:

  • No Physical requirements other than sitting at a desk most of the day and looking at a computer screen.

Travel Requirements:

  • 0%

items.content:
DevOps Engineer (Remote)

United States, Georgia
Company: Bishop Fox

Overview

We are trusted advisors to the world’s leading businesses, governments, and organizations mdash helping to secure their commerce, data, IT infrastructure, and intellectual property. From critical infrastructure to credit cards social media to mobile games flight navigation systems to frozen waffle factories mdash wersquore right there, advising every bit of the way. Wersquore hiring a DevOps Engineer to join and advance our engineering team. Who You Are and What Yoursquoll Do You are a DevOps professional seeking a new role ndash one with ample opportunity. You are more than ready to take a new mission and run with it. And in the case of Bishop Fox, that mission will be to relentlessly design, automate, enhance, and ultimately maintain one of our most important infrastructures. This, in turn, will improve reliability and performance while maximizing developer velocity and quality of life. At Bishop Fox, your success will be measured by the following outcomes Designing and developing infrastructure via automation tools to host our core product Creating and maintaining continuous delivery tools to enable developers Maintaining and ensuring product services health through instrumentation, monitoring, failover, and alerting systems Automating and verifying capacity needs are met as demanded for product services In your first six months, you will have mastered the following Building a fully functional delivery pipeline Integrating monitoring and alerting systems Performing critical infrastructure upgrades Developing an operational dashboard to better system instrumentation Scaling existing systems in accordance with use We pride ourselves on our culture at Bishop Fox. You will be surrounded by some of the most brilliant minds in the cybersecurity industry working here will continually push you to be better each day. Not only that ndash we all work hard, but we know when to take a step back. We value our time and our well-being, and we look out for each other. Everyone here plays a role in our success. Why Bishop Fox Bishop Fox offers competitive salary, generous benefits, flexible schedules, and travel. If yoursquore looking for opportunities to grow professionally, this is the place. Yoursquoll work alongside some of the most talented and experienced security consultants in the industry. We have a casual workplace environment, but welsquore consummate professionals. Your Experience The following is a list of skills you will have in your repertoire. If you have most of these, wersquod like to speak to you. Experience in object-oriented languages Golang would be a plus Knowledge of relational databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, mssql) Previous experience in developing or software engineering Amazon Web Services (AWS) experience An interest in cybersecurity would be ideal A degree is nice to have, but by no means a necessity Emotional intelligence + ego-less intelligence Flexibility you adapt to dynamic environments well Autonomy ndash you work well on your own Demonstrable proof of your work (a GitHub or GitLab link, a portfolio, or other selected samples) This position will be fully remote. Interested candidates should submit a link to their portfolio of recent relevant work in addition to their resume and cover letter. Resumes without cover letters will not be considered. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.

Apply for job

items.content:
DevOps Engineer at Pear Deck

Remote | International

We’re looking for someone who gets energy in a dynamic role, who would enjoy helping other developers with tools, monitoring our services in Kubernetes, and helping our team understand acute technical issues.

Things you may do on a given day:

  • Stand up with the cross-functional product team and agree on top priorities for the day
  • Monitor production systems for disruptions to valuable classroom time and react quickly
  • Review a PR
  • Fix a bug
  • Make improvements to our CI/CD pipeline
  • Talk with another dev about recent improvements to our internal tooling
  • Identifying potential projects to cut our cloud spend
  • Develop a plan to make monitoring or operational improvements
  • Twiddle some knobs in the GCP console while building long-term IaC solutions
  • Improve our workflow orchestration

Prior to this, it is likely you:

  • Have dealt with Javascript. A lot of it.
  • Have worked well with non-technical leaders and technical leaders alike
  • Worked with service-oriented architecture and other infrastructure patterns
  • Used programming design patterns
  • Have demonstrated honesty, determination, brilliance, and humility

About Pear Deck

Pear Deck is a five-year-old funded startup headquartered in Iowa City, IA, focused on delivering powerful learning moments to every student, every day. By joining Pear Deck at this stage in our growth, you will be getting in during an exciting time as we expand our team while maintaining our humanity. So, if you like the idea of working on a close-knit crew as we face the challenges of scaling both our customers and our team, this is the perfect time to jump in.

We value diversity and encourage people from all walks of life to join our team. We believe a wealth of perspectives helps Pear Deck serve its teachers better.

items.content:
DevOps Engineer with fluent German (m/w) Karlsruhe or remote ;-)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level, Senior
Role: DevOps, System Administrator
Industry: IT Recruitment
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private
Company: Ganz & Stock | Karlsruhe, Deutschland

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+01:00) Berlin +/- 2 hours
Office Location: Karlsruhe, Deutschland. Employees can also work full time from this office.
Relocation Assistance: Yes

Technologies

ansible
kubernetes
sysadmin
devops

Job description

Ganz & Stock ist eine Personalberatung, die sich auf den digitalen
Bereich spezialisiert hat. Wir arbeiten für führende Unternehmen der Branche und
besetzen Fach- und Führungspositionen.

Unser Kunde, die marbis GmbH mit ihrer Marke „Nitrado“ ist ein weltweit
führender Anbieter im Bereich Gameserver-Hosting. Alle unsere Kernkomponenten
sind von unserem Entwicklungs-Team selbstentwickelt. Die Software, die wir
schreiben, wird täglich von zehntausenden Nutzern verwendet. Diese Nutzer sind
sowohl Endkunden, die privat Dienste mieten, als auch Business- Partner, zu denen
Spieleentwickler unterschiedlichster Größe zählen.

Wir suchen am Standort Karlsruhe (oder remote) eine(n):

Site Reliability Engineer / DevOp (m/w)

Dich erwartet

  • Ein schlagkräftiges, junges Team mit Kollegen, die deine Begeisterung teilen. Wir legen viel Wert auf konstruktives Feedback, Kommunikation und Teamkultur.
  • Technische Diskussionen und Entscheidungsfindung haben den Stellenwert, den sie verdienen.
  • Moderne Infrastruktur und Tooling
  • Konsequentes Konfigurationsmanagement und Automatisierung - etwa mit Ansible und Kubernetes - sind Selbstverständlichkeiten. Das bedeutet aber nicht, dass wir auf jeden Hype aufspringen: wir legen großen Wert auf solides Systemdesign und Sicherheit.
  • Anspruchsvolle Aufgaben
  • Eine Firma, für die Infrastruktur kein Kostenfaktor, sondern Kernkompetenz ist.
  • Anspruchsvolle B2B-Kunden, mit denen wir vertrauensvoll zusammenarbeiten.
  • Die maßgebliche Mitarbeit und Mitgestaltung von spannenden “Grüne Wiese”Projekten. Wir setzen unsere eigene SDN-Software ein, um den
  • Performanceanforderungen unserer Kunden gerecht zu werden. Hier werden CPU
  • Zyklen und L3-Cache-Misses gezählt!

Schlussendlich

  • Ein großes Büro, legendäre Sommerfeste, Weihnachtsfeiern und Seminare, eine eigene Küche, in der unsere Köchin uns jeden Mittag Essen auf den Tisch zaubert,sowie angemessene Bezahlung.

Wir erwarten

  • Fundierte Erfahrung mit der Administration geschäftskritische Produktivsysteme. Hierzu gehört neben den technischen Fähigkeiten auch grundlegendes Verständnis von modernen SRE-Prozessen wie (sinnvoll eingesetztes) Change Management und Postmortems.
  • Tiefes Verständnis von Linux-Systemadministration und Tooling.
  • Gute bis sehr gute Kenntnisse einer Programmiersprache wie Python / Golang
  • Schnelle Fehleranalyse und Debugging.
  • Die Fähigkeit und Motivation, Dich schnell in neue Technologien und Themenfelder einzuarbeiten. Wir sind ein kleines Team in einer Branche, die so dynamisch ist wie kaum eine andere. Es besteht daher sowohl die Gelegenheit, wie auch die Notwendigkeit regelmäßig neue Technologien zu evaluieren und einzusetzen.
  • Guter bis sehr guter schriftlicher Ausdruck in Englisch, sowie die Bereitschaft,offen und proaktiv zu kommunizieren. Unsere Firmensprache ist Englisch - wir beschäftigen Mitarbeiter aus vielen unterschiedlichen Ländern und haben eine Außenstelle in Reno, Nevada. Im Büro in Karlsruhe wird Deutsch gesprochen.

Vorteilhaft, aber nicht notwendig

  • Verständnis von Netzwerken, BGP und der Juniper-Plattform (MX, QFX).
  • Erfahrung mit Kubernetes und BGP-basierten SDNs.
  • Grundlagen der Windows-Systemadministration. Während unsere Management Infrastruktur komplett auf Linux basiert, laufen sehr viele der Anwendungen, die wir betreiben, auf Windows-Servern. Statt klassischer “Windows-Skills” wie Active Directory geht es hier um Performanceanalyse, Monitoring und Automatisierung mit PowerShell.
  • Low Level-C-Kenntnisse und Erfahrung mit Network Function Virtualization.
  • Linux-Kernelinstrumentation mit Systemtap, eBPF und perf.
  • Grundlagen der Webentwicklung für die Mitarbeit an (internen) Administrations
  • Tools für uns und unsere B2B-Kunden.

Wenn Position und Aufgaben zu deinen Qualifikationen passen, freuen uns auf deine
Bewerbung mit möglichem Eintrittstermin und Gehaltsvorstellungen per E-Mail
a.ganz@ganz-stock.de oder einfach eine eine Antwort via Stack.

Alexander Ganz

Geschäftsführender Gesellschafter bei Ganz & Stock

Apply now

About Ganz & Stock

Flache Hierarchien

Agilität im Unternehmen fest verankern

Langfristige Perspektive (das Unternehmen ist seit über Jahren am Markt).

Interne Karriereoptionen, Trainings & Weiterbildung.

Balance : Flexible Arbeitszeiten, Home Office teilweise möglich, Obst

Gut mit öffentlichen Verkehrsmitteln zu erreichen

Benefits

  • Digital Jobs
  • Agile Jobs
  • Varies per client

items.content:
Sr. Systems Engineer

United States, Indiana
Company: Keller Schroeder

Overview

Keller Schroeder has been growing, and we are continuing to expand our operations. If you are a proven performer, we would like you to take a closer look at working for us. We are in need of a Senior Systems Engineer to join our in-house Networking Solutions Group. The Senior Systems Engineer is responsible for providing design, implementation, and technical support to clients for their physical and virtual data center infrastructure. This includes identifying opportunities for the use of technology to improve business efficiency, performing infrastructure design tasks, assessing existing design and implementation practices, performing system implementations, and providing support for clientsrsquo server and storage environments. Green Card sponsorship is not available for this position. 8 Reasons why the average tenure is 8+ years for our Network Solutions Group (NSG) team Pursue your true talents – How many employers truly ask you where you see yourself in 5 years and then help you get there? Flexibility Autonomy ndash Initially yoursquoll spend more time in our office training, however, our team has a great deal of flexibility to tailor the right combination of remote, office and on-site time to get the job done and accommodate personal client scheduling needs. More GrowthNever Boring ndash You wonrsquot be stuck working on a single platform or industry and instead will work on challenging projects in a variety of environments implementing cutting-edge solutions. Quality of Life ndash Occasionally yoursquoll schedule yourself to help a client after hours and we reciprocate by returning the favor with personal and comp. time. Team ndash Catered lunches for trainingcelebrations throughout the year and an awesome internal support team and engineers to work with that make the day a blast with a ldquono man left behindrdquo attitude! Stable Long-Term ClientsFewer Emergencies ndash We retain clients much like we do team members with many of our client tenures exceeding 15 years. This creates a more stable environment for everyone and the way we manage workflow leads to very few ldquopanickedrdquo callsemails and late hours. Benefits Package ndash ESOPProfit-Sharing, PersonalComp Time, Great PTOVacationPaid Holiday package, HealthDentalVisionLifeDisability Employee Owned ndash Our ownership mindset saturates every aspect of our company culture. Our Client Support Group to Sales to Executive Leadership are focused on keeping our clients and employee owners highly satisfied. Bonus! Voted 21 Best SmallMedium Business in 2017 Great Places To Work survey httpreviews.greatplacetowork.comkeller-schroeder1 httpreviews.greatplacetowork.comkeller-schroeder1 Technical Requirements you need to join our team as Sr. Systems Engineer 6+ years Information Technology Experience VMware design, implementation, and support experience – current certifications preferred SAN and NAS design, implementation, and support experience (NetApp, HPE Nimble preferred) Server Hardware design and support experience (Cisco UCS, HP, andor Dell) Experience in Windows Server Data network design, implementation, and support experience Backup Disaster Recovery planning, implementation, and testing experience (Veeam preferred) Personal Requirements you need to join our Team Client Facing ndash confidently explain complex technologies to all levels of leadership Pre-Sales ndash assist our Account Mangers with identifying opportunities where our clients can make use of new technologies to improve their business, not just our bottom line Design Implementation ndash Yoursquoll work directly with other Senior Engineers to design solutions, then implement your designs for our clients Organized – develop and maintain clear and concise documentation Stay Current ndash proven ability to keep pace with latest technologies and skills Minimal travel requirements ndash reliable transportation required Our continued growth means we have openings at all technical levels! Even if you generally meet most of the requirements we may still be interested. We are very interested in finding the right culture fit and an individual hungry to learn new skills! We look forward to receiving your resume in Word format. Our company was founded in 1978. Since 1996 we have aggressively expanded into technologies such as web-based and client server development tools as well as networking and infrastructure products. items.title: Paid Ads Operations Manager
items.content:
Paid Ads Operations Manager at Perfect Keto

Remote | Freelance | Part-time

REMOTE
Austin, Texas, United States
Marketing

DESCRIPTION
We are seeking a remote Paid Ads Operations Manager to build launch, optimize, and scale paid ad campaigns in Facebook, Pinterest and other ad platforms. The ideal candidate is highly data-driven/analytical, eager to test new creative concepts, and has a deep understanding of ROI and LTV. Must thrive in a fast-paced startup environment and be comfortable with heavy tactical work. Bonus points if passionate about health/wellness.

  • This role is built around a project rate and will be tasked with roughly 20 hours per week.
  • This remote role is a unique opportunity to work from anywhere in the US!

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Build paid advertising campaigns in Facebook, Pinterest, Youtube, Display and similar platforms as needed..
  • Optimize bids, budget, and creative to execute against Perfect Keto’s growth KPIs
  • Consistently refresh/test creative and landing pages to find conversion rate lifts
  • Roll up test learnings to Director of Paid Advertising.
  • Leverage both internal analytics as well as ad platform data and communicate actionable insights to Director.
  • Work cross-functionally across the organization as required for specific projects
  • Ensure all creative and messaging running adheres to our brand guidelines

REQUIREMENTS:

  • 1-3 years of experience in a similar role at a consumer e-commerce business or high-growth tech company
  • Expert level understanding of paid media channels (Facebook & Pinterest, most importantly).
  • Expert in Excel
  • Great at collaborating across multiple teams.
  • Comfort working in a fast-paced, rapidly scaling, remote working environment.
  • Bachelor’s degree or higher

This position is remote from any US city.

BENEFITS
No employee benefits are available for Freelance and Contract Employees.

Apply for job

The Senior Systems Engineer is responsible for providing design, implementation, and technical support to clients for their physical and virtual data center infrastructure. This includes identifying opportunities for the use of technology to improve business efficiency, performing infrastructure design tasks, assessing existing design and implementation practices, performing system implementations, and providing support for clientsrsquo server and storage environments. Green Card sponsorship is not available for this position. 8 Reasons why the average tenure is 8+ years for our Network Solutions Group (NSG) team Pursue your true talents – How many employers truly ask you where you see yourself in 5 years and then help you get there? Quality of Life ndash Occasionally yoursquoll schedule yourself to help a client after hours and we reciprocate by returning the favor with personal and comp. time. Team ndash Catered lunches for trainingcelebrations throughout the year and an awesome internal support team and engineers to work with that make the day a blast with a ldquono man left behindrdquo attitude! The senior engineer will serve as a technical lead and interact with other telecom and IT team members as well as various internal customers and external vendors. The following are high level requirements for the role 5+ Years Collaboration Engineering Experience w Cisco Call Manager v9+ Lead and SME for a broad range of Collaboration Related Tools (Jabber, MRA, Video etc.) CCNA or Related Certification Preferred Responsibilities Responsible for project implementation and technical support for the organizations Unified Communications related technologies which includes but not limited to Communications Manager, Unity Connections, Cisco Instant Messaging and Presence(Jabber), Informacast, Cisco Emergency Responder and Expressway CE Design and ensure through resolution Ability to operate within VMWare virtualization environment as an administrator andor collaborate with Virtualization team on Cisco CSeries Servers Work with VoIP and traditional knowledge base documentation for all communications systems Determines appropriate monitoring of all systems and applications Plans and assists with the execution of upgrades and software implementations Ability to design and implement solutions based on complex business requirements Perform other duties as assigned Experience 6 years experience in telecommunications Cisco Call Manager environment is preferred Experience working with outside vendors, carrier, and network services is required Capable of communicating complex technical topics to a wide variety of audiences Demonstrate the ability to apply technology solutions to business problems Versed with various operating systems and application software is a requirement VoIP, SIP, CTI, and UC experience are a requirement Knowledge of commonly used concepts, practices, and procedures as they relate to call routing, and capacity planning
